children.desc: Dozens of collections from a wide variety of cultures across all major time periods are covered, including a collection of 190,000 old master drawings originally photographed at over 100 different repositories, 20 years of contemporary New York City gallery shows, archives of Islamic textiles, the restored Ghiberti 'Gates of Paradise', African masks, medieval manuscripts, images of all exhibitions shown at MoMA, and many others. Today, the Artstor Digital Library shares 1.8 million images in the arts, architecture, humanities, and sciences from outstanding museums, photo archives, photographers, scholars, and artists.

children.name: ATLA Religion Database with ATLASerials
children.subject: Classics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: ATLA Religion Database® (ATLA RDB®) with ATLASerials® (ATLAS®) combines the premier index to journal articles, book reviews, and collections of essays in all fields of religion with ATLA's online collection of major religion and theology journals. The ATLA Religion Database includes more than 620,000 article citations from more than 1,746 journals (575 currently indexed), more than 250,000 essay citations from over 18,000 multi-author works, more than 570,000 book review citations, and a growing number of multimedia citations. Coverage in this database begins in 1949 although indexing for some journal titles extends back into the nineteenth century. In ATLASerials, full text is provided for more than 380,000 electronic articles and book reviews from more than 220 journals selected by leading religion scholars in the United States. This database is produced by the American Theological Library Association.

children.name: Brill's New Pauly
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: Brill´s New Pauly is the English edition of the authoritative Der Neue Pauly, published by Verlag J.B. Metzler since 1996. The encyclopaedic coverage and high academic standard of the work, the interdisciplinary and contemporary approach and clear and accessible presentation have made the New Pauly the unrivalled modern reference work for the ancient world.

children.name: Humanities Full Text
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Humanities Full Text includes many of the most important academic journals in the humanities with the full text of articles from over 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, and high-quality indexing for almost 700 journals—of which 470 are peer-reviewed—dating as far back as 1984. The database provides coverage of feature articles, interviews, bibliographies, obituaries, and original works of fiction, drama, poetry and book reviews, as well as reviews of ballets, dance programs, motion pictures, musicals, radio and television programs, plays, operas, and more. Topics covered include classical studies, literary & social criticism, philosophy, religion & theology, literature, art, dance, film, folklore, music, performing arts, area studies, communications, gender studies, history, journalism, linguistics, archaeology, and much more.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: L'anne philologique
children.subject: Classics|History|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: A specialized bibliographic database of scholarly works relating to all aspects of ancient Greek and Roman civilizations. Its subjects are Greek and Latin literature and linguistics, including early Christian texts and patristics, Greek and Roman history, art, archaeology, philosophy, religion, mythology, music, science, and scholarly sub-specialties such as numismatics, papyrology and epigraphy.

children.name: Literature Online
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages
children.desc: A leading online resource for the study and teaching of literature in English. It is a fully integrated service that combines the texts of over 355,000 literary works with a vast library of key criticism and reference resources. Includes full-text journals and author biographies.

children.name: Literature Resource Center
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Modern Languages
children.desc: Reliable online resource for research on literary topics, authors, and their works. Its coverage includes all genres and disciplines, all time periods, and all regions of the world. Provides access to biographies, bibliographies, and critical analyses of authors from every age and literary discipline. Covers novelists, essayist, poets, journalists, and other writers, with in-depth coverage of the most-studied authors.

children.name: Loeb Classical Library
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: a series of books which presents important works of ancient Greek and Latin literature in a way designed to make the text accessible to the broadest possible audience, by presenting the original Greek or Latin text on each left-hand page, and a fairly literal translation on the facing page.

children.name: MLA International Bibliography
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages|International Studies|Humanities
children.desc: Offers a detailed bibliography of journal articles, books and dissertations. This database includes journal abbreviations and acronyms for almost 3,500 titles, with full journal names standardized and ISSNs attached. MLA International Bibliography also contains nearly 11,000 subject names and terms. Includes a proprietary thesaurus used to assign descriptors to each record in the bibliography; and a proprietary, searchable directory of noted authors' names, with links to brief descriptive notes.

children.name: Naxos Spoken Word Library
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Includes literature and poetry from medieval times to the twentieth century, and many newly written texts supplement an ever-expanding range of non-fiction.

children.name: Neue Pauly (Der)
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: The English edition of the authoritative Der Neue Pauly. In nearly 20,000 entries it covers two thousand years of history and culture of Greco-Roman Antiquity and the reception of this in the two thousand years that followed.

children.name: Oxford Classical Dictionary
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: Covers all aspects of the classical world from literature and history to religion, science, and archaeology.  As well as providing factual information, the Dictionary contains many thematic entries on subjects relevant to the 21st century such as nationalism, race, gender, and ecology. Anthropology and reception have been added as new subject areas, covering topics such as creolization and kinship, as well as dance reception and translation.

children.name: Project Muse
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|Government & Politics|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Humanities|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: Full-text of scholarly, peer-reviewed journals focusing on the fields of literature and criticism, history, the visual and performing arts, cultural studies, education, political science, gender studies, and many others. Browse by title or research area. 1995 to present.

children.name: Thesaurus Linguae Graecae
children.subject: Classics|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: The project has collected and digitized most texts written in Greek from Homer (8 c. B.C.) to the fall of Byzantium in AD 1453 and beyond. Its goal is to create a comprehensive digital library of Greek literature from antiquity to the present era. note: users must now register for a personal account in order to gain access.

children.name: ACM Digital Library
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media
children.desc: ACM publications online, including a 70+year archive of over 50 ACM journals, magazines, and peer-reviewed articles, conference proceedings, and ACM SIG newsletters. Also contains third-party content with selected archives from books, journals, proceedings and theses.

children.name: Applied Science & Technology Full Text
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media|Environmental Science|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience
children.desc: Applied Science & Technology Full Text™ contains indexing and abstracts for nearly 800 core English-language, scientific and technical publications back to 1983. Full text of articles is available from more than 220 periodicals dating back to 1997, including page images that provide access to original illustrations, charts and photographs. Content includes coverage of a wide variety of applied science specialties—acoustics to aeronautics, neural networks to nuclear and civil engineering, computers and informatics and much more—from leading trade and industrial journals, professional and technical society journals, specialized subject periodicals, buyers’ guides, directories and conference proceedings.

children.name: Computing Research Repository (CRR)
children.subject: Computer Science
children.desc:
CoRR is a repository of Computer Science research at Cornell University.
Computing research relies heavily on the rapid dissemination of results. As a result, the formal process of submitting papers to journals has been augmented by other, more rapid, dissemination methods.

children.name: dblp computer science bibliography
children.subject: Computer Science
children.desc: The dblp computer science bibliography is an on-line reference for bibliographic information on major computer science publications. It has evolved from an early small experimental web server to a popular open-data service for the computer science community. dblp currently indexes over 2.6 million publications, published by more than 1.4 million authors. To this end, dblp indexes about than 25 000 journal volumes, more than 24 000 conferences or workshops, and more than 17 000 monographs. They focus on international publications, that is, publications in English, although there are exceptions to this rule. Without the resources to cover each and every publication venue that exists, dblp tries to prioritize the inclusion of venues based on their scientific merit and importance to the computer science community.

children.name: Derwent Innovations Index
children.subject: Computer Science
children.desc: Facilitates rapid, precise patent searching, letting you conduct patent and citation searches of inventions in chemical, electrical, electronic, and mechanical engineering. Covering over 14.3 million basic inventions.

children.name: IEEE Xplore Digital Library
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to full-text from some of the world's most highly cited publications in electrical engineering, computer science and electronics. The content comprises journals, conference proceedings, technical standards, eBooks and educational courses. Covers material published since 1988 with select content published since 1950.

children.name: Inspec
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Physics|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to the world's scientific and technical literature in physics, electrical engineering, electronics, communications, control engineering, computers and computing, and information technology. Dates of coverage: 1969 through the present.

children.name: Mathematics - arXiv.org
children.subject: Computer Science|Natural Sciences|Mathematics
children.desc: Open access to e-prints in Mathematics. Includes Algebraic Geometry, Algebraic Topology, Differential Geometry, Functional Analysis, Group Theory, Logic, Statistics Theory, and more.

children.name: Physics - arXiv.org
children.subject: Computer Science|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mathematics
children.desc: Electronic archive and distribution server for research articles. It provides open access to e-prints in Physics.

children.name: ProQuest Computing
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Digital Arts/Media
children.desc: Coverage of computer topics, including database design, software development, web commerce, LANs, WANs, intranets and the internet. The database includes around 450 titles, with over 350 available in full text.

children.name: Federal Response to Radicalism in the 1960s
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Criminal Justice
children.desc: From the Federal Bureau of Investigation Library, this product illuminates the enduring conflict in American history between the need of society to protect basic freedoms and the equally legitimate need to protect itself from genuine threats to its security and existence. Organized alphabetically by organization, this collection covers a wide range of viewpoints on political, social, cultural, and economic issues. It sheds light on internal organization, personnel, and activities of some of the most prominent American radical groups and their movements to change American government and society. This collection supports a wide variety of courses in U.S. history, cultural studies, radical politics, and social movements. It covers 1956 to 1971 and contains 87,391 images from files on such individuals as Chavez, Malcolm X and Hoffman and groups such as the Black Panther Party and Students for a Democratic Society and the Weatherman Underground Organization.

children.name: Federal Surveillance of African Americans, 1920-1984
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|History|Criminal Justice
children.desc: Between the early 1920s and early 1980s, the Justice Department and its Federal Bureau of Investigation engaged in widespread investigation of those deemed politically suspect. Black Americans of all political persuasions were subject to federal scrutiny, harassment, and prosecution. Prominent among the targets of this sometimes coordinated, sometimes independent surveillance were aliens, members of various protest groups, Socialists, Communists, pacifists, militant labor unionists, ethnic or racial nationalists, and outspoken opponents of the policies of the incumbent presidents. There are 88,021 images covering the period 1920 to 1984. The value of this collection can be charted in several respects. First, it is a vast treasure of largely untapped source materials for the major social movements and key figures in early twentieth century black history. Second, it provides a window into the development of America’s first systematic domestic surveillance apparatus. Finally, it illuminates the enduring conflict in American history between the need of society to protect basic freedoms and the equally legitimate need to protect itself from genuine threats to its security and existence.

children.subject: Digital Arts/Media|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc:
Art Full Text™ is a comprehensive resource for art information featuring full-text articles from more than 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, high-quality indexing and abstracting of over 600 periodicals dating as far back as 1984, including 280 peer-reviewed journals, as well as indexing and abstracting of over 13,000 art dissertations. Indexing of almost 200,000 art reproductions provides examples of styles and art movements, including works by emerging artists. The database covers fine, decorative and commercial art, folk art, photography, film, and architecture, and also includes a database-specific thesaurus.

Topics covered include art history & criticism, architecture & architectural history, archaeology, antiques, museum studies, graphic arts, industrial design, landscape architecture, interior design, folk art, painting, photography, pottery, sculpture, decorative arts, costume design, television and video, motion pictures, advertising art, non-western art, textiles and much more.

children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Part of the Web of Science database, a multidisciplinary database covering the journal literature of the arts and humanities, with cited references but not abstracts. Indexes 1,300+ of the world's leading arts and humanities journals, plus individually selected, relevant items from over 7,000 major science and social science journals. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Oxford Art Online
children.subject: Digital Arts/Media|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: The authority on art from pre-history to present day. Includes: The Oxford Companion to Western Art; The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms; and the Encyclopedia of Aesthetics. Also articles about topics, bibliographies for further research, and thousands of searchable images made available through Oxford's partnerships with museums, galleries, and other outstanding arts organizations. Through a single, elegant gateway users can access—and simultaneously cross-search—an expanding range of Oxford’s acclaimed art reference works: Grove Art Online, the Benezit Dictionary of Artists, the Encyclopedia of Aesthetics, The Oxford Companion to Western Art, and The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms, as well as many specially commissioned articles and bibliographies available exclusively online.

children.subject: Business|Economics|Social Sciences
children.desc: Includes global, trade and industry, and dateline components with full‐text journals and titles from the business press, key trade publications, working papers, dissertations, conference proceedings, and market reports. Also includes ABI/INFORM Archive, which offers a deep backfile.

children.name: ABSEES Online
children.subject: Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Education
children.desc: Provides information on East-Central Europe and the former Soviet Union. Sources indexed include journals, books, dissertations, online resources and selected government publications published in the U.S. and Canada. Coverage from 1989-present.

children.name: Accounting & Tax
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Includes highly ranked global and scholarly journals covering current news and topics, as well as the trends and history influencing important accounting and tax issues of the day. 1971 - current

children.name: AdAge Data Center
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Includes data on the marketing and advertising industry. Top companies, listing of top executives, holdings of the top 50 Global Advertising Agencies, market analysis, history of brands and advertising, job listings, profiles, and major holdings of the nation's 100 Leading Media Companies.

children.name: Banking Information Source
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: This database enables you to search essential banking industry publications for information about the financial services industry, banking and industry trends from 1971 to the present. In today's banking world, keeping informed of what's happening in economic markets is as important as monitoring national and international developments. Banking Information Source can help users predict future market trends, monitor the rise of future competition, and even pick up ideas that have worked successfully in the financial services market. The database brings together leading journals from the most important international markets and allows you to analyze and compare articles from 360 full-text sources.

children.name: Business Abstracts with Full Text
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Business Abstracts with Full Text™ contains the full text of articles from more than 510 key publications dating back to 1995, and provides access to product evaluations, interviews, biographical sketches, corporate profiles, obituaries, surveys, statistical rankings, book reviews and reports from associations, societies, trade shows, conferences and more. Additional content includes quality indexing and abstracts for more than 900 publications dating back to 1982, as well as over 600,000 corporate names with cross references to specific industries and countries.Subject coverage includes accounting, acquisitions & mergers, advertising, banking, chemicals and pharmaceuticals, communications, economics, entertainment industry, finance, financial services, government regulations, industrial relations, insurance, international business, investments, marketing, retail trade, small business and much more.

children.name: Business Economics and Theory Collection
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Provides access to academic journals and magazines focusing on topics in economics and related fields. The database has an emphasis on titles indexed in the American Economic Association's EconLit bibliography.

children.name: Business Insights: Essentials
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc:
A fully integrated resource bringing together company profiles, brand information, rankings, investment reports, company histories, chronologies and periodicals. Search this database to find detailed company and industry news and information.300 sources for investment research/brokerage reports
1,000 SWOT reports, updated quarterly
2,200 corporate chronologies
3,900 full-text periodicals
11,500 market research reports
14,000 industry research reports from Datamonitor
15,000 company histories
50,500 articles from Market Share Reporter
70,000 associations
80,000 articles from Gale’s Business Rankings Annual
465,000 company profiles including 2,000 with deep links to related content and statistical data

children.name: Business Review
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Includes access to 40 business journals across the U.S. and automatic updates throughout the day with breaking business news in the Capital Region. Also with Best Places To Work guides; 40 Book of Lists resource books; People on the Move sections; and more. Sign up for customized local news.

children.name: Business Source Premier (Enhanced Business Searching interface)
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: The Business Searching Interface (BSI) provides an easy way to both browse and search for country economic data, company profiles, industry information and market research, and then use the results as limiters in a keyword search, if desired.

children.name: Business Source Premier
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Business Source Premier is the industry’s most used business research database, providing full text for more than 2,300 journals, including full text for more than 1,100 peer-reviewed business publications. This database provides full text back to 1886, and searchable cited references back to 1998. Journal ranking studies reveal that Business Source Premier is superior to the competition in full text coverage in all disciplines of business, including marketing, management, MIS, POM, accounting, finance and economics. The database also includes other sources of full text information such as country economic reports from the EIU, Global Insight, ICON Group and CountryWatch and detailed company profiles for the world's 10,000 largest companies. This database is updated daily on EBSCOhost.

children.name: Conference Board Online Database
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Most importantly, The Conference Board's work enables us to share and understand best practices across industries, countries and corporations.  Full-text coverage from 1995 to date.

children.name: Data Planet Statistical Datasets
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|Sociology|Social Sciences
children.desc: Statistical DataSets provides direct access to numerical data from federal, state and private organizations with more than 600 indicators and multiple criteria to personalize data output. Popular DataSets indicators include stock prices, unemployment rates, national debt and housing starts. The Data-Planet repository contains more than 18.9 billion data points from 3.9 billion time series sourced from more than 70 source organizations. There are billions of charts, maps, views, rankings, time series and tables available for use in the Data-Planet repository. All of the data have been standardized and structured, and are described with up to 37 fields of metadata, including a controlled vocabulary.To check which datasets are included in Statistical Datasets, or to see if your institution subscribes to any premium datasets, go into Statistical Datasets and look at the Indicator column along the left. If you subscribe, you'll see the premium datasets listed, along with all available datasets in the indicator tree on the left-hand side of the screen.

children.name: EconLit
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: EconLit is a reliable source of citations and abstracts to economic research dating back to 1886. It provides links to full-text articles in all fields of economics, including capital markets, country studies, econometrics, economic forecasting, environmental economics, government regulations, labor economics, monetary theory, urban economics, and much more. There is keyword indexing of six types of record: journal articles, books, collective volume articles, dissertations, working papers, and full-text book reviews from the Journal of Economic Literature. These sources bring the total records available in the database to more than 1.2 million.

children.name: Entrepreneurship
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Search worldwide publications and multi-media related to the topic of Entrepreneurship. Intended to bridge theory with practice, the Entrepreneurship database covers a wide spectrum of resources useful to educators, researchers, students and practitioners. Content ranges from the scholarly - including journals, dissertations, working papers and conference proceedings - to a full toolkit of practical guides, templates, forms, sample business plans and tips from successful entrepreneur in a wide range of formats - from video to downloadable Word and Excel files, as well as traditional text and PDFs.

children.name: Europa World
children.subject: Economics|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Europa World is the online version of the Europa World Year Book, the indispensable source of information on world-wide affairs. First published in 1926, the year book is renowned as one of the world's leading reference works, covering political and economic information in over 250 countries and territories, from Afghanistan to Zimbabwe. Statistical data by country and directory contact details of nearly 2000 international organizations.

children.name: Historical Statistics of the United States
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|Government & Politics|History|International Studies|Social Sciences|Statistics
children.desc: Download tables in Excel or CSV; also download entire groups of tables as a zip file; a compendium of statistics from over 1000 sources has been expanded to include over 37,000 data series.

children.name: Hoover's Company Profiles
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: This database contains proprietary information about more than 40,000 public and non-public companies and 225,000 key executives. Hoover's, widely recognized as a leader in company data, delivers in depth industry analyses, information on a company's location, summary financials, top competitors, top officers and more.

children.name: Mergent Online
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: A fully searchable database with financials details of over 25,000 active and inactive U.S. companies; access to companies representing over 95% of the non-U.S. global market capitalization; Annual reports from globally listed companies, with archived reports for over 15 years; Information on all direct and indirect subsidiaries of a company; and daily updates on confirmed executives from all U.S. traded companies, featuring profiles on current and former executives, including executive biographies and compensation information.

children.name: Monthly Statistics of International Trade
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc:
A reliable and up-to-date source of international statistics on international trade of OECD countries. It provides detailed insight into the most recent trends in trading patterns among OECD countries and with the
rest of the world. Data are broken down by economic groupings, by country and by region, and include seasonally adjusted series as well as calculated indicators. Includes ready-made tables, interactive databases, 'at a glance publications', and full reports.

children.name: New Palgrave Dictionary of Economics Online
children.subject: Economics
children.desc: Contains full text of 2008 print edition, incorporates quarterly additions and updates, offers excellent search and browse facilities, contains hyperlinked cross-references within articles, selected and maintained links to related sites, and provides access to full text of the 1987 Archive edition.

children.name: OECD International Direct Investment Statistics
children.subject: Business|Economics|Social Sciences
children.desc: This database gathers detailed historical statistics on international direct investment to and from the OECD area. Data are broken down by geographical zone and industrial sector for direct investment flows and stocks.

children.name: OxResearch
children.subject: Economics|Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Provides analytical articles covering world and regional economic and political developments of major significance. It evaluates issues and events within a coherent political, social and economic framework. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: ProQuest Asian Business & Reference
children.subject: Business|Economics|Asian Studies
children.desc:
Offers detailed information on companies, economies, markets, and overall business conditions throughout the Eastern Hemisphere.
News and current awareness sources; country information and statistics; policy and analysis; people and institutions. 1971 - current but full text for certain publications is subject to market availability.

children.name: ProQuest Entrepreneurship
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Covering a wide spectrum of resources useful to educators, researchers, students and practitioners. Content ranges from the scholarly - including journals, dissertations, working papers and conference proceedings - to a full toolkit of practical guides, templates, forms, sample business plans and tips from successful entrepreneur in a wide range of formats - from video to downloadable Word and Excel files, as well as traditional text and PDFs.

children.name: ProQuest European Business
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Contains the latest European business and financial information. Includes quality resources such as The Economist, Fortune and European Business Journal. Coverage: 1971 - current

children.name: ProQuest Social Science Journals
children.subject: Economics|Anthropology|Education|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice
children.desc: It covers core disciplines across the social sciences including sociology, social work, anthropology, politics and other areas, featuring journals from over 50 countries, facilitating multidisciplinary research and providing researchers with a variety of perspectives.

children.name: Reference USA
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Provides business and consumer data, with instant, real-time access to accurate, in-depth information on 24 million U.S. businesses and 1.5 million Canadian Businesses. Research executives and companies, find news articles, conduct job searches, research papers, locate addresses and phone numbers, conduct market research and much more.

children.name: Regional Business News
children.subject: Business|Economics|Social Sciences
children.desc: Regional Business News incorporates 80 business journals, newspapers and newswires covering all metropolitan and rural areas within the United States.

children.name: Social Explorer
children.subject: Business|Economics|American Studies|Education|History|Political Science|Social Sciences|Religious Studies
children.desc: An online research tool designed to provide quick and easy access to current and historical census data and demographic information. Interactive custom maps, downloadable reports, and more.

children.name: Social Sciences Citation Index
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Education|History|Sociology|Social Sciences|Ethics
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the social sciences from 1997 to the present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Statista
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|Social Sciences
children.desc: 1 million statistics from over 18,000 sources (including both national and international data). Over 60,000 topics in 20 multidisciplinary categories, ranging from agriculture to media & marketing and consumer & demographic data. 1,100 Statista Dossiers and Industry Reports. 10,000 studies & reports from third parties. Download in XLS, PPT or PNG Formats.

children.name: Statistical Abstract of the United States (ProQuest)
children.subject: Business|Economics|Government & Politics|History|Social Sciences
children.desc: A comprehensive summary of statistics on the social, political, and economic organization of the United States; with individually indexed tables (and attached spreadsheets), both searchable and browsable. A convenient volume for statistical reference, and as a guide to sources of more information both in print and on the Web.

children.name: Statistical Insight
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: ProQuest Statistical Insight provides abstracting, indexing, and full text for publications from hundreds of public domain and licensed sources, including federal statistical publications; state government and business statistical reports; international statistical publications from the UN, OECD, EU, and more

children.name: Trade and Investment (IMF)
children.subject: Business|Economics|International Studies
children.desc: Part of the IMF eLibrary Data Resource. Build queries for specific countries, topic and source combinations to produce data sets on trade and investment.

children.name: Value Line
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Provides investment research on stocks, mutual funds, options and convertibles, and offers a family of no-load mutual funds. Accurate investment research on companies, industries, markets and economies.

children.name: Wall Street Journal
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: The financial newspaper of record offering in-depth coverage of national and international finance as well as first rate coverage of hard news. Full text from 1984 to present.

children.name: Wall Street Journal, Eastern edition
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: The financial newspaper of record offering in-depth coverage of national and international finance as well as first rate coverage of hard news. Full text coverage 1984-present.

children.name: Wall Street Journal: Historical Newspapers (1889 - 1998)
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides users with easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

children.name: World Development Indicators
children.subject: Economics|International Studies
children.desc: World Development Indicators (WDI) publication is a collection of time-series data for 214 economies, with many indicators going back more than 50 years. WDI provides cross-country comparable statistics about development and people’s lives around the globe. It is divided into six sections -- World View, People, Environment, Economy, States and Markets, and Global Links.

children.name: ABSEES Online
children.subject: Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Education
children.desc: Provides information on East-Central Europe and the former Soviet Union. Sources indexed include journals, books, dissertations, online resources and selected government publications published in the U.S. and Canada. Coverage from 1989-present.

children.name: Data Planet Statistical Datasets
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|Sociology|Social Sciences
children.desc: Statistical DataSets provides direct access to numerical data from federal, state and private organizations with more than 600 indicators and multiple criteria to personalize data output. Popular DataSets indicators include stock prices, unemployment rates, national debt and housing starts. The Data-Planet repository contains more than 18.9 billion data points from 3.9 billion time series sourced from more than 70 source organizations. There are billions of charts, maps, views, rankings, time series and tables available for use in the Data-Planet repository. All of the data have been standardized and structured, and are described with up to 37 fields of metadata, including a controlled vocabulary.To check which datasets are included in Statistical Datasets, or to see if your institution subscribes to any premium datasets, go into Statistical Datasets and look at the Indicator column along the left. If you subscribe, you'll see the premium datasets listed, along with all available datasets in the indicator tree on the left-hand side of the screen.

children.name: Education Full Text
children.subject: Education
children.desc: Education Full Text™ provides full text of articles from over 350 journals as far back as 1996, in addition to indexing of over 770 periodicals dating back to 1983. Content includes in-depth coverage of special education, with over 50 journals dedicated to this important topic, and more than 100,000 controlled and cross-referenced names of educational tests. Subject coverage includes adult education, continuing education, literacy standards, multicultural/ethnic education, teaching methods and much more.

children.name: ERIC
children.subject: Education
children.desc: ERIC, the Education Resource Information Center, provides access to education literature and resources. The database provides access to information from journals included in the Current Index of Journals in Education and Resources in Education Index. The database contains more than 1.3 million records and links to more than 323,000 full-text documents dating back to 1966.

children.name: Historical Statistics of the United States
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|Government & Politics|History|International Studies|Social Sciences|Statistics
children.desc: Download tables in Excel or CSV; also download entire groups of tables as a zip file; a compendium of statistics from over 1000 sources has been expanded to include over 37,000 data series.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: Professional Development Collection
children.subject: Education|Social Sciences
children.desc: Provides a collection of high quality education journals, including more than 350 peer-reviewed titles. The database also contains educational reports. The majority of full text titles included in the database are available in native (searchable) PDF, or scanned-in-color. Full text dates back to 1965.

children.name: ProQuest Education
children.subject: Education|Social Sciences
children.desc: Access to over 900 top educational publications, including more than 600 of the titles in full text. Covers not only the literature on primary, secondary, and higher education but also special education, home schooling, adult education, and hundreds of related topics. Many titles are indexed in the ERIC database.

children.name: ProQuest Social Science Journals
children.subject: Economics|Anthropology|Education|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice
children.desc: It covers core disciplines across the social sciences including sociology, social work, anthropology, politics and other areas, featuring journals from over 50 countries, facilitating multidisciplinary research and providing researchers with a variety of perspectives.

children.name: Social Explorer
children.subject: Business|Economics|American Studies|Education|History|Political Science|Social Sciences|Religious Studies
children.desc: An online research tool designed to provide quick and easy access to current and historical census data and demographic information. Interactive custom maps, downloadable reports, and more.

children.name: Social Sciences Citation Index
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Education|History|Sociology|Social Sciences|Ethics
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the social sciences from 1997 to the present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Social Sciences Full Text
children.subject: American Studies|Asian Studies|Education|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|International Studies|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Subject coverage includes addiction studies, anthropology, community health & medical care, communications, economics, environmental studies, ethics, family studies, gender studies, geography, international relations, law, mass media, minority studies, political science, psychiatry, psychology, public welfare, social work, urban studies and much more.

children.name: Statista
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|Social Sciences
children.desc: 1 million statistics from over 18,000 sources (including both national and international data). Over 60,000 topics in 20 multidisciplinary categories, ranging from agriculture to media & marketing and consumer & demographic data. 1,100 Statista Dossiers and Industry Reports. 10,000 studies & reports from third parties. Download in XLS, PPT or PNG Formats.

children.name: Statistical Insight
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: ProQuest Statistical Insight provides abstracting, indexing, and full text for publications from hundreds of public domain and licensed sources, including federal statistical publications; state government and business statistical reports; international statistical publications from the UN, OECD, EU, and more

children.name: ACM Digital Library
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media
children.desc: ACM publications online, including a 70+year archive of over 50 ACM journals, magazines, and peer-reviewed articles, conference proceedings, and ACM SIG newsletters. Also contains third-party content with selected archives from books, journals, proceedings and theses.

children.name: Applied Science & Technology Full Text
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media|Environmental Science|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience
children.desc: Applied Science & Technology Full Text™ contains indexing and abstracts for nearly 800 core English-language, scientific and technical publications back to 1983. Full text of articles is available from more than 220 periodicals dating back to 1997, including page images that provide access to original illustrations, charts and photographs. Content includes coverage of a wide variety of applied science specialties—acoustics to aeronautics, neural networks to nuclear and civil engineering, computers and informatics and much more—from leading trade and industrial journals, professional and technical society journals, specialized subject periodicals, buyers’ guides, directories and conference proceedings.

children.name: GreenFILE
children.subject: Engineering|Environmental Science|Geology
children.desc: Its collection of scholarly, government and general-interest titles includes content on the environmental effects of individuals, corporations and local/national governments, and what can be done at each level to minimize these effects. Topics covered include global climate change, green building, pollution, sustainable agriculture, renewable energy, recycling, and more.

children.name: IEEE Xplore Digital Library
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to full-text from some of the world's most highly cited publications in electrical engineering, computer science and electronics. The content comprises journals, conference proceedings, technical standards, eBooks and educational courses. Covers material published since 1988 with select content published since 1950.

children.name: Inspec
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Physics|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to the world's scientific and technical literature in physics, electrical engineering, electronics, communications, control engineering, computers and computing, and information technology. Dates of coverage: 1969 through the present.

children.name: ProQuest Computing
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Digital Arts/Media
children.desc: Coverage of computer topics, including database design, software development, web commerce, LANs, WANs, intranets and the internet. The database includes around 450 titles, with over 350 available in full text.

children.name: ProQuest Science and Technology
children.subject: Engineering|Biology|Environmental Science|Geology|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Includes access to ProQuest Science and Technology databases. BioOne Abstracts, Pollution Abstracts, Biology Journals, Applied and General Science journals, and more.

children.name: Science Citation Index
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mechanical Engineering|Bioethics|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the sciences. With cited references from 1997 to the present. Includes new cited references to patents per week. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Web of Science
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Environmental Science|Physics|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: Includes ISI Science Citation Index 1997-present; Social Sciences Citation Index, 1997-present; and Arts & Humanities Citation Index, 1997-present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: African American Poetry: 1750-1900
children.subject: Africana Studies|English & American Literature
children.desc: Part of Literature Online, African-American Poetry contains poems by African-American poets of the 18th and 19th centuries. The early history is covered, from the first recorded poem by an African American (Lucy Terry's 'Bars Fights', c.1746) to the major poets of the nineteenth century, including Paul Laurence Dunbar and Frances Ellen Watkins Harper.

children.name: American Drama 1714-1915
children.subject: English & American Literature|Theater & Dance
children.desc: Containing more than 1,500 dramatic works from the early 18th century up to the beginning of the 20th, American Drama 1714–1915 reflects American dramatic writing in all its richness and diversity: plays in verse, farces, melodramas, minstrel shows, realist plays, frontier plays, temperance dialogues and a range of other genres are represented. It also provides exhaustive coverage of the printed record of African American drama and frequently-studied plays by major dramatists are placed in the context provided by the dramatic writings of lesser-known contemporaries and canonical authors not primarily remembered for their dramatic works, such as Louisa May Alcott and Emma Lazarus.

children.name: American Film Scripts Online
children.subject: Film Studies|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: American Film Scripts Online contains 1,009 scripts by 1,062 writers together with detailed, fielded information on the scenes, characters and people related to the scripts. In addition, the database includes facsimile images for more than 500 of these screenplays. Most of the scripts have never been published before, and are not available anywhere else online.

children.name: American Poetry
children.subject: American Studies|English & American Literature
children.desc: American Poetry covers the Colonial period to the early 20th century, and drawn from over 1,200 printed sources, including four anthologies published before 1840 in their entirety. The entire text of each poem has been included. Any accompanying text written by the poet and forming an integral part of the poem, such as dedications, notes, arguments and epigraphs, is also included. Poems published only in journals, gazettes, or periodicals have generally been excluded, as have translations.

children.name: Archives of the Federal Writers' Project: Literature, Culture and Society in Depression Era America
children.subject: History|English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: The Federal Writers' Project (FWP) was the most controversial and contentious program of the Work Projects Administration (WPA), an integral part of Franklin D. Roosevelt's New Deal. This bold, imaginative and wide-ranging enterprise is the key to understanding literature, culture and society in America during the Depression era. This collection presents the Federal Writers’ Project (FWP) publications of all 47 states involved in the project, which ran from 1933 to 1943. Forming the most complete collection of publications from all participating states, this archive contains more than 450 individual items, many of which are typed or mimeographed and received only limited circulation. This unique collection of the publications of the FWP provides scholars with an extremely lively and detailed picture of life in America during the Great Depression. Almost every aspect of life is covered from industry andlabor relations, through welfare and government, to sports and hobbies.

children.name: Archives Unbound
children.subject: Africana Studies|American Studies|Government & Politics|History|English & American Literature|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc:
Archives Unbound presents topically-focused digital collections of historical documents. Search across all collections or browse
the 17 individual collections. Free index to all collections included.

children.name: Bibliography of American Literature
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: Bibliography of American Literature describes the works of America's most important literary writers from the time of the Revolution to 1930. More than 37,000 works of 281 American writers from the period of the Revolution to 1930 are listed, essentially the complete printed record of American literature from the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. This database aims to include all first editions, chronologically arranged, of each author listed. In addition, it includes any book (pamphlet, broadside, etc.) containing the first appearance of any prose (except letters) or poetry by such authors. It records variant issues and states of the first editions, as well as details of illustrations and maps, and standard and variant publishers' bindings. European editions in English are included as and where necessary. Reprints which might be confused with first editions, and subsequent editions containing important textual changes by the author, are briefly noted. A selective list of bibliographical, biographical and critical works is also given for each author. It excludes authors who died after the end of 1930, along with historians and writers of travel books whose works are not primarily of literary interest. Persons who were primarily juvenile authors, or authors of scientific and medical works, textbooks, sermons, or other material 'not of the character of belles-lettres', are also excluded.

children.name: Canadian Poetry
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: Containing more than 19,000 poems by 177 poets drawn from over 700 printed sources, many of them rare and inaccessible outside Canada, the collection comprises essentially the complete canon of English-language Canadian poetry from the seventeenth century up to the early twentieth. All poems published in book form have been included, as have uncollected broadsheet and serial publications before 1850; post-1850 broadsheet and serial publications have been included at the discretion of the editorial board. Translations have not been included unless they assumed a wider importance and became part of the fabric of contemporary cultural life. In all cases, the electronic text is a diplomatic transcription of its printed source, free of silent emendation. The entire text of each poem has been included. Any accompanying text written by the poet and forming an integral part of the poem, such as dedications, notes, arguments and epigraphs, is also generally included.

children.name: Contemporary Authors
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: For more than 30 years, Contemporary Authors (CA) has been the primary resource for information on modern authors, including those who were active prior to 1960 and whose works continue to influence contemporary literature. This database provides complete biographical and bibliographical information and references on more than 130,000 U.S. and international authors in a wide range of media including current writers in fiction, general nonfiction, poetry, journalism, drama, motion pictures, television, and other fields.

children.name: Contemporary Literary Criticism
children.subject: English & American Literature|Modern Languages
children.desc: Contemporary Literary Criticism (CLC) is the world's leading resource for information on modern literature. Since the appearance of the first volume of CLC in 1973, researchers have grown to depend on this reference work for timely critical analysis of key literary works. CLC Select presents significant published criticism on the works of novelists, poets, playwrights, short story writers, and other creative writers now living or who died after January 1, 2000.Each entry contains the following: a biographical essay that discusses the author's life, works, and critical importance; critical essays or excerpts taken from books, magazines, literary reviews, newspapers, and scholarly journals; and, where available, interviews with featured authors. A complete bibliographical citation prefaces each critical essay and most essays are introduced by a brief annotation that establishes a context and purpose for the criticism. Entries also provide suggestions for further reading.

children.name: Dictionary of American Regional English
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: The digital Dictionary of American Regional English (DARE) offers powerful searching and interactive browsing by region, quotations with a complete bibliography, and maps illustrating where words were collected. The addition of DARE Survey data and audio recordings provides a dynamic resource for understanding the nature of words and their usage.

children.name: Dictionary of Literary Biography
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc:
Provides more than 13,000 biographical and critical essays on the lives, works, and careers of the world's most influential literary figures from all genres and time periods of American and British literature and selected other literatures.Entries contain:
Personal information: birth/death dates, nationality/ethnicity, principal genres, awards, family history, and some entries include an author portrait.
Principal Works: a list of the author's most important writings.
Further Readings about the Author: a list of additional writings,published interviews, biographies, and a bibliography of writings about the author

children.name: Dictionary of Old English Corpus
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: An essential electronic reference for all scholars of Old and Middle English. the Dictionary of Old English Web Corpus is an online database consisting of at least one copy of every surviving Old English text. In some cases, more than one copy is included, if it is significant because of dialect or date. As such, the DOE Web Corpus represents over three million words of Old English and fewer than a million words of Latin, or almost five times the collected works of Shakespeare.

children.name: Early American Fiction 1789-1850
children.subject: American Studies|English & American Literature
children.desc: Facsimile page images and keyword-searchable full text for more than four hundred works of American prose fiction published before 1850, including key titles such as James Fenimore Cooper's The Last of the Mohicans, Edgar Allan Poe's Tales of the Grotesque and Arabesque and Nathaniel Hawthorne's The Scarlet Letter. In total, Early American Fiction 1789–1850 comprises 421 titles in 560 volumes by 81 authors, containing more than 125,000 pages. Each title is available in its entirety as a series of facsimile page images in full colour, including text, illustrations, spine, endpapers, covers and edges.

children.name: Early American Fiction 1789-1875
children.subject: American Studies|English & American Literature
children.desc: Early Early American Fiction 1789–1875 extends the coverage of its predecessor by twenty-five years (1851–1875) and incorporates the full text of more than 300 additional titles and over 50 new authors It offers the full text of 875 first editions of American novels and short stories by such authors as Louisa May Alcott, Herman Melville, Harriet Beecher Stowe and Mark Twain, as well as a host of minor writers of the period. Each title in Early American Fiction 1789–1875 is available in its entirety as a series of facsimile page images in full colour, including text, illustrations, spine, endpapers, covers and edges.

children.name: Early English Books Online (EEBO)
children.subject: History|English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: Early English Books Online (EEBO) contains digital facsimile page images of virtually every work printed in England, Ireland, Scotland, Wales and British North America and works in English printed elsewhere from 1473-1700 - from the first book printed in English by William Caxton, through the age of Spenser and Shakespeare and the tumult of the English Civil War. <--From the first book published in English through the age of Spenser and Shakespeare, this incomparable collection now contains more than 125,000 titles in many subject areas, including English literature, history, philosophy, linguistics, theology, music, fine arts, education, mathematics, and science.-->

children.name: Early English Prose Fiction
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: Early English Prose Fiction is a balanced and representative survey of fictional prose in English from the period 1500­­­–1700, comprising more than 200 works. The database includes numerous rare texts inaccessible in print form together with early editions of all the best-known works of the period, such as John Bunyan’s The Pilgrim’s Progress and Sir Philip Sidney’s Arcadia. Many different kinds of fiction are represented, from prose romances through to popular jest books and specimens of rogue literature. Each text is reproduced in full, including all prefatory matter and annotation by the original author. Texts are accompanied by bibliographic information relating to the source edition used. Illustrations integral to the text are included, as are errata lists. The collection excludes non-fictional prose and medieval ‘survivals’ (works pre-dating the period in question but printed within it). Works of fiction translated from other languages are excluded.

children.name: Editions and Adaptations of Shakespeare (1591-1911)
children.subject: English & American Literature|Theater & Dance
children.desc: As part of the Individual Literature Collection from Literature Online, Editions and Adaptations of Shakespeare contains eleven major editions from the First Folio of 1623 to the Cambridge edition of 1863-6, twenty-eight separate contemporary printings of individual plays and poems, selected apocrypha and related works. In addition it contains more than one hundred adaptations, sequels and burlesques from the seventeenth, eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, including the whole of Bell's Acting Edition of Shakespeare's Plays (1774). In the great majority of cases texts have been captured entire, with all introductions, prefaces, appendices, indices, notes editorial and authorial, essays, tables, figures, illustrations etc. reproduced in full. Hypertext links have been created to connect editorial matter to the texts whenever possible. Where omissions have been made they are noted in the relevant bibliographic entry.

children.name: Eighteenth Century Collections Online (ECCO)
children.subject: History|English & American Literature
children.desc: In the most ambitious single digitization project ever undertaken, 138,000 English-language titles (155,000 volumes) and editions published between 1701 and 1800 have been made available online. It allows full-text searching of 26 million pages of material, in essence, every significant English-language and foreign- language title printed in the United Kingdom, along with thousands of important works from the Americas. ECCO picks up where EBBO leaves off.The collection is an ongoing project based on The English Short Title Catalogue (ESTC), a machine-readable union list of the holdings of the British Library, as well as those from more than 1,500 university, private, and public libraries worldwide.

children.name: Eighteenth-Century Fiction
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: A collection of 96 complete works of English prose from the period 1700–1780 by writers from the British Isles. Key figures covered include Daniel Defoe, Henry Fielding, Eliza Haywood, Samuel Richardson, Tobias Smollett, Laurence Sterne and Jonathan Swift. In addition to a scanned version of Sterne's Tristram Shandy, the collection also contains two different editions of Richardson's Clarissa and Pamela, and of Swift's Gulliver's Travels. The entire text of each individual work has been included, with all prefatory matter and annotation by the original author. All accompanying material, such as illustrations, contents pages, appendices, lists of subscribers, dedications, errata lists, etc. also appears. Only material having no bearing on the work in question or its author (such as a publisher's advertisements for other texts) has been excluded.

children.name: English Drama
children.subject: English & American Literature|Theater & Dance
children.desc: English Drama contains more than 3,900 plays in verse and prose from the late thirteenth century - the likely date of the Shrewsbury Fragments - to the early twentieth. It offers exhaustive coverage of the prodigious dramatic literature of the Elizabethan and Jacobean periods, as well as Restoration plays, medieval morality plays and mystery cycles, and nineteenth-century closet dramas. In addition to works by major dramatists such as Ben Jonson, Aphra Behn, William Wycherley, Oliver Goldsmith, Richard Sheridan, Oscar Wilde and J. M. Synge, English Drama includes the dramatic writings of many more neglected writers long inaccessible in print form. The database contains works acted on or intended for the stage. It includes masques, interludes, short dramatic pieces, translations and adaptations, closet dramas, and works written for children. Each text is reproduced in full, as is accompanying text written by the playwright and forming an integral part of the play, such as epigraphs, castlists, and notes. Commendatory and prefatory poems by the playwright and others have also been included.

children.name: English Poetry
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc:
The collection contains over 160,000 poems, essentially comprising the complete canon of English poetry of the British Isles from the 8th century to around 1900. Drawn from nearly 4,500 printed sources, more than 1,250 poets are represented. The entire text of each poem has been included. Any accompanying text written by the poet and forming an integral part of the poem, such as dedications, notes, arguments and epigraphs, is also generally included. Certain categories of material have not generally been included:
Translations into English verse after 1800
Hymns published after 1800
Works in languages other than English
Unpublished manuscript poems or those only published in contemporary newspapers, journals, or miscellanies
Verse dramas intended for the stage (these are included in the complementary Chadwyck-Healey collection English Drama)

children.name: English Poetry, Second Edition
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: English Poetry, Second Edition contains over 183,000 poems, essentially comprising the complete canon of English poetry of the British Isles and the British Empire from the 8th century to the early 20th. Drawn from nearly 4,900 printed sources, more than 2,700 poets are represented. It redefines the English poetic canon for the 21st century, building on the achievement of the original English Poetry collection with enhanced functionality and the addition of more than 20,000 poems. The most comprehensive archive of English verse available now offers incomparable representation both of the literary heritages of former colonial countries and of the poetic legacies of English writers who have only been brought back to scholarly attention during the last thirty years.

children.name: Essay and General Literature Index
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: A bibliographic database that cites 65,000 essays contained in some 5,300 anthologies and collections and miscellaneous works published in the United States, Great Britain, and Canada. More than 300 volumes are indexed annually. Full bibliographic information on collective titles are indexed as well. Topics covered include art history & criticism, architecture & architectural history, archaeology, antiques, museum studies, graphic arts, industrial design, landscape architecture, interior design, folk art, painting, photography, pottery, sculpture, decorative arts, costume design, television and video, motion pictures, advertising art, non-western art, textiles and much more.

children.name: Faber Poetry Library
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: The Faber Poetry Library contains the works of 50 poets comprising 140 volumes of poetry. The authors are all part of the Faber Poetry list and the database enjoys the active support of the publisher and the poets or their estates. Authors covered include Simon Armitage, Rupert Brooke, Wendy Cope, T. S. Eliot, Lavinia Greenlaw, Thom Gunn, Seamus Heaney, Ted Hughes, David Jones, Louis MacNeice, Andrew Motion, Paul Muldoon, Tom Paulin, Sylvia Plath, Siegfried Sassoon, Stephen Spender and Edward Thomas. The entire text of each poem has been included. Indexes of titles and first lines, prefatory material and notes have been excluded. The date of first publication indicates the date of first publication by Faber and Faber.

children.name: Humanities Full Text
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Humanities Full Text includes many of the most important academic journals in the humanities with the full text of articles from over 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, and high-quality indexing for almost 700 journals—of which 470 are peer-reviewed—dating as far back as 1984. The database provides coverage of feature articles, interviews, bibliographies, obituaries, and original works of fiction, drama, poetry and book reviews, as well as reviews of ballets, dance programs, motion pictures, musicals, radio and television programs, plays, operas, and more. Topics covered include classical studies, literary & social criticism, philosophy, religion & theology, literature, art, dance, film, folklore, music, performing arts, area studies, communications, gender studies, history, journalism, linguistics, archaeology, and much more.

children.name: Johns Hopkins Guide to Literary Theory and Criticism
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: Its chronological range extends from Plato and Aristotle to the present, with wide geographical and cultural coverage. The guide consists of alphabetically arranged entries on individual critics and theorists, critical and theoretical schools and movements, and the critical and theoretical innovations of specific countries and historical periods. Each entry includes a selective primary and secondary bibliography, and there are extensive cross references.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: Literature Online
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages
children.desc: A leading online resource for the study and teaching of literature in English. It is a fully integrated service that combines the texts of over 355,000 literary works with a vast library of key criticism and reference resources. Includes full-text journals and author biographies.

children.name: Literature Resource Center
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Modern Languages
children.desc: Reliable online resource for research on literary topics, authors, and their works. Its coverage includes all genres and disciplines, all time periods, and all regions of the world. Provides access to biographies, bibliographies, and critical analyses of authors from every age and literary discipline. Covers novelists, essayist, poets, journalists, and other writers, with in-depth coverage of the most-studied authors.

children.name: MLA International Bibliography
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages|International Studies|Humanities
children.desc: Offers a detailed bibliography of journal articles, books and dissertations. This database includes journal abbreviations and acronyms for almost 3,500 titles, with full journal names standardized and ISSNs attached. MLA International Bibliography also contains nearly 11,000 subject names and terms. Includes a proprietary thesaurus used to assign descriptors to each record in the bibliography; and a proprietary, searchable directory of noted authors' names, with links to brief descriptive notes.

children.name: Naxos Spoken Word Library
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Includes literature and poetry from medieval times to the twentieth century, and many newly written texts supplement an ever-expanding range of non-fiction.

children.name: New York Review of Books
children.subject: English & American Literature|Political Science
children.desc: Includes reviews, in-depth articles on politics, books, and culture. Access complete archive from 1963 to present.

children.name: Nineteenth-Century Fiction
children.subject: English & American Literature
children.desc: A collection of 250 British and Irish novels from the period 1782 to 1903. Major novelists of the period such as Austen, Scott, Mary Shelley, Dickens, Eliot, Hardy and the Brontës feature alongside popular romances, sensation fiction, colonial adventure novels and children's literature. In addition to the better-known novels, the collection covers many neglected or little-known works, most of them out of print or difficult to find. Each text is reproduced in full, including all prefatory matter and annotation by the original author.

children.name: Poets on Screen
children.subject: English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: Poets On Screen contains video clip recordings of poets reading their own and other poets' work. Browse a list of poems read by contemporary poets; the poems can be viewed alphabetically by author/reader or by poem  title.

children.name: Project Muse
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|Government & Politics|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Humanities|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: Full-text of scholarly, peer-reviewed journals focusing on the fields of literature and criticism, history, the visual and performing arts, cultural studies, education, political science, gender studies, and many others. Browse by title or research area. 1995 to present.

children.name: ProQuest Research Library: Literature & Language
children.subject: English & American Literature|Modern Languages|Humanities
children.desc: A sub-set of ProQuest Central, subject content includes World Literatures and Linguistics

children.name: Twentieth-Century African-American Poetry
children.subject: Africana Studies|English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: A database of modern and contemporary African American poetry, featuring poems by the most important African American poets of the last century, including Langston Hughes, Jean Toomer, Imamu Amiri Baraka, Audre Lorde and Rita Dove.

children.name: Twentieth-Century American Poetry
children.subject: English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: Includes a unique survey of the movements, schools and distinctive voices of modern and contemporary American poetry. Major movements of the century are represented, including the Black Mountain school of Charles Olson and Robert Duncan, the Deep Image poetry of Robert Bly and James Wright, underground literature by the Beat poets, the influential feminist works of Adrienne Rich, and the works by the confessional poets. The entire text of each poem has been included.

children.name: Twentieth-Century English Poetry
children.subject: English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: A collection of more than 600 volumes of poetry by 283 poets from 1900 to the present day, including W.B. Yeats, Rudyard Kipling, Thomas Hardy, Wilfred Owen, Thom Gunn, Fleur Adcock, Paul Muldoon, Tony Harrison, Benjamin Zephaniah and Carol Ann Duffy, and incorporating the poets in The Faber Poetry Library. From modernist experiment to post-modern playfulness, from Georgian convention to free-verse confession, and from Edwardian poetry of empire to post-imperial diversity.

children.name: Underground and Independent Comics, Comix, and Graphic Novels
children.subject: English & American Literature|Sociology|Humanities
children.desc: Underground and Independent Comics is the first-ever scholarly online collection for researchers and students of adult comic books and graphic novels. Includes primary materials (the comics themselves), and materials about comics—interviews, commentary, theory, and criticism—from The Comics Journal and other secondary sources.

children.name: World Shakespeare Bibliography Online
children.subject: English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: The World Shakespeare Bibliography Online is a searchable electronic database consisting of the most comprehensive record of Shakespeare-related scholarship and theatrical productions published or produced worldwide between 1960 and 2016. It provides annotated entries for all important books, articles, book reviews,dissertations, theatrical productions, reviews of productions, audiovisual materials, electronic media, and other scholarly and popular materials related to Shakespeare.

children.name: Agricultural & Environmental Science Database
children.subject: Environmental Science|Geology|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Combines information on scientific research and government policies in a single resource. Material from conference proceedings and hard-to-find documents has been summarized along with information from primary journals in the field. Coverage from 1981 to the present.
