children.desc: Diverse primary source materials reflecting broad views across American history and culture have been assembled into comprehensive databases. Includes African American Newspapers, American County Histories, Civil War Newspapers, Godey’s Lady’s Book, The Pennsylvania Gazette, History of Woman Suffrage, Frank Leslie’s Weekly, The Liberator, Twelve Years a Slave, and more.

children.name: ACLS Humanities E-Book (HEB)
children.subject: Humanities
children.desc: Includes cross-searchable books in the humanities selected by scholars for their continuing importance for research and teaching.

children.name: American Film Institute Catalog
children.subject: Film Studies|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: The AFI Catalog covers the history of American cinema comprehensively from 1893 to 1975, with full or short records for films from 1976-2011. New records are added each year.

children.name: American Film Scripts Online
children.subject: Film Studies|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: American Film Scripts Online contains 1,009 scripts by 1,062 writers together with detailed, fielded information on the scenes, characters and people related to the scripts. In addition, the database includes facsimile images for more than 500 of these screenplays. Most of the scripts have never been published before, and are not available anywhere else online.

children.name: Archives of the Federal Writers' Project: Literature, Culture and Society in Depression Era America
children.subject: History|English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: The Federal Writers' Project (FWP) was the most controversial and contentious program of the Work Projects Administration (WPA), an integral part of Franklin D. Roosevelt's New Deal. This bold, imaginative and wide-ranging enterprise is the key to understanding literature, culture and society in America during the Depression era. This collection presents the Federal Writers’ Project (FWP) publications of all 47 states involved in the project, which ran from 1933 to 1943. Forming the most complete collection of publications from all participating states, this archive contains more than 450 individual items, many of which are typed or mimeographed and received only limited circulation. This unique collection of the publications of the FWP provides scholars with an extremely lively and detailed picture of life in America during the Great Depression. Almost every aspect of life is covered from industry andlabor relations, through welfare and government, to sports and hobbies.

children.name: Art Full Text
children.subject: Digital Arts/Media|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc:
Art Full Text™ is a comprehensive resource for art information featuring full-text articles from more than 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, high-quality indexing and abstracting of over 600 periodicals dating as far back as 1984, including 280 peer-reviewed journals, as well as indexing and abstracting of over 13,000 art dissertations. Indexing of almost 200,000 art reproductions provides examples of styles and art movements, including works by emerging artists. The database covers fine, decorative and commercial art, folk art, photography, film, and architecture, and also includes a database-specific thesaurus.

Topics covered include art history & criticism, architecture & architectural history, archaeology, antiques, museum studies, graphic arts, industrial design, landscape architecture, interior design, folk art, painting, photography, pottery, sculpture, decorative arts, costume design, television and video, motion pictures, advertising art, non-western art, textiles and much more.

children.name: Art Index Retrospective
children.subject: Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: Providing users access with over half a century of art literature, Art Index Retrospective 1929 -1984 includes high-quality indexing of nearly 600 publications many of which are peer- reviewed and citations of over 25,000 book reviews. Coverage includes fine, decorative and commercial arts.

children.name: Artfl Project
children.subject: History|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: Founded in 1982 the ARTFL Project is a consortium-based service that provides its members with access to North America's largest collection of digitized French resources.

children.name: Arts & Humanities Citation Index
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Part of the Web of Science database, a multidisciplinary database covering the journal literature of the arts and humanities, with cited references but not abstracts. Indexes 1,300+ of the world's leading arts and humanities journals, plus individually selected, relevant items from over 7,000 major science and social science journals. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Brill's New Pauly
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: Brill´s New Pauly is the English edition of the authoritative Der Neue Pauly, published by Verlag J.B. Metzler since 1996. The encyclopaedic coverage and high academic standard of the work, the interdisciplinary and contemporary approach and clear and accessible presentation have made the New Pauly the unrivalled modern reference work for the ancient world.

children.name: Early English Books Online (EEBO)
children.subject: History|English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: Early English Books Online (EEBO) contains digital facsimile page images of virtually every work printed in England, Ireland, Scotland, Wales and British North America and works in English printed elsewhere from 1473-1700 - from the first book printed in English by William Caxton, through the age of Spenser and Shakespeare and the tumult of the English Civil War. <--From the first book published in English through the age of Spenser and Shakespeare, this incomparable collection now contains more than 125,000 titles in many subject areas, including English literature, history, philosophy, linguistics, theology, music, fine arts, education, mathematics, and science.-->

children.name: FIAF International Index to Film Periodicals Plus
children.subject: Film Studies|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: The International Federation of Film Archives (FIAF) brings together institutions dedicated to rescuing and preserving films. FIAF's editorial staff, along with its Affiliates, produces the International Index to Film Periodicals which offers in-depth coverage of the world's foremost academic and popular film journals. This database contains FIAF's “Treasures from Film Archives”; a detailed index of the silent-era film holdings of archives from around the world, a selection of Reference volumes and the linked full-text of over 60 journals.

children.name: Fine Arts and Music Collection
children.subject: Film Studies|Music|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: Fine Arts and Music Collection provides access to scholarly journals and magazines that support research in areas including drama, music, art history, and filmmaking.

children.name: Frank Leslie’s Weekly
children.subject: American Studies|History|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Frank Leslie’s Weekly, later often known as Leslie’s Weekly, actually began life as Frank Leslie’s Illustrated Newspaper. Founded in 1855 and continued until 1922, it was an American illustrated literary and news publication, and one of several started by publisher and illustrator Frank Leslie. John Y. Foster was the first editor of the Weekly, which came out on Tuesdays. While only 30 copies of the first edition were printed, by 1897 its circulation had grown to an estimated 65,000 copies. They followed a tested and proven formula of carefully combining elements of war, politics, art, science, travel and exploration, literature and the fine arts in each issue, enhanced with between 16 and 32 illustrations. Throughout its decades of existence, Frank Leslie’s Weekly provided illustrations and reports — first with woodcuts and Daguerreotypes, later with more advanced forms of photography — of wars from John Brown’s raid at Harpers Ferry and the Civil War until the Spanish-American War and the First World War. It also gave extensive coverage to less martial events such as the Klondike gold rush of 1897, the laying of the 1858 Atlantic Cable and the San Francisco earthquake.

children.name: Humanities Full Text
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Humanities Full Text includes many of the most important academic journals in the humanities with the full text of articles from over 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, and high-quality indexing for almost 700 journals—of which 470 are peer-reviewed—dating as far back as 1984. The database provides coverage of feature articles, interviews, bibliographies, obituaries, and original works of fiction, drama, poetry and book reviews, as well as reviews of ballets, dance programs, motion pictures, musicals, radio and television programs, plays, operas, and more. Topics covered include classical studies, literary & social criticism, philosophy, religion & theology, literature, art, dance, film, folklore, music, performing arts, area studies, communications, gender studies, history, journalism, linguistics, archaeology, and much more.

children.name: Incites (formerly Journal Citation Reports)
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Resource includes citation data from 11,000+ scholarly and technical journals from more than 3,300 publishers in over 80 countries. Includes virtually all areas of science, technology, and social sciences. Shows the most frequently cited journals in a field; highest impact journals in a field; and largest journals in a field.

children.name: L'anne philologique
children.subject: Classics|History|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: A specialized bibliographic database of scholarly works relating to all aspects of ancient Greek and Roman civilizations. Its subjects are Greek and Latin literature and linguistics, including early Christian texts and patristics, Greek and Roman history, art, archaeology, philosophy, religion, mythology, music, science, and scholarly sub-specialties such as numismatics, papyrology and epigraphy.

children.name: Loeb Classical Library
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: a series of books which presents important works of ancient Greek and Latin literature in a way designed to make the text accessible to the broadest possible audience, by presenting the original Greek or Latin text on each left-hand page, and a fairly literal translation on the facing page.

children.name: MLA International Bibliography
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages|International Studies|Humanities
children.desc: Offers a detailed bibliography of journal articles, books and dissertations. This database includes journal abbreviations and acronyms for almost 3,500 titles, with full journal names standardized and ISSNs attached. MLA International Bibliography also contains nearly 11,000 subject names and terms. Includes a proprietary thesaurus used to assign descriptors to each record in the bibliography; and a proprietary, searchable directory of noted authors' names, with links to brief descriptive notes.

children.name: Music Online: Classical Music Library
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc:
Currently provides streaming access to classical works that can be browsed by composer and the results sorted by title, date of composition and genre.
More than 400 distinct instrument categories.

children.name: Music Online: Classical Scores Library vol. 1
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc:
Classical Scores Library: Volume I is the largest and most comprehensive online scores database designed to support the teaching and research of classical music. It provides online access to more than 25,000 scores and nearly 440,000 pages that can be printed and annotated. All major genres and time periods from medieval to contemporary, from choral works to symphonies, operas, and the avant-garde.
All major score types: full score, study score, piano score, and vocal score.

children.name: Music Online: Classical Scores Library, Volume 1
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: A series of three volumes contains the most important classical music scores, manuscripts, and previously unpublished material, allowing for the study and analysis of musical scores. With full, study, piano, and vocal scores.

children.name: Music Online: Contemporary World Music
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: With nearly 155,000 albums and 1,931,837 tracks, Contemporary World Music delivers the sounds of all regions from every continent. The database contains important genres such as reggae, worldbeat, neo-traditional, world fusion, Balkanic jazz, African film, Bollywood, Arab swing and jazz, and other genres such as traditional music - Indian classical, fado, flamenco, klezmer, zydeco, gospel, gagaku, and more. Searchable by genre, places, performers, cultural groups, instruments, or titles.

children.name: Music Online: Contemporary World Music
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: Delivers the sounds of all regions from every continent.

children.name: Music Online: Garland Encyclopedia of World Music
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: More than 10,000 pages of material, combined with entries by more than 700 expert contributors from all over the world, make this the most complete body of work focused on world music. This release includes 1,210 essays and images from 10 sources and hundreds of audio examples

children.name: Music Online: Jazz Music Library
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Music Online: Jazz Music Library is the largest and most comprehensive collection of streaming jazz available online — with thousands of jazz artists, ensembles, albums, and genres.

children.name: Music Online: Listening
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: A multidisciplinary collection of audiovisual content that touches on the curriculum needs of virtually every department. This collection allows students and researchers to analyze unique and valuable content from over 500 producers and distributors around the world.

children.name: Music Online: Opera in Video
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: A comprehensive collection of operatic performances covering the most commonly studied operas in music history, opera literature, and performance classes. Multiple productions of the most studied operas allow for comparative analysis, showing various interpretations of staging/set design. Interviews with singers, stage designers, and directors, integrated with excerpts of live performances.

children.name: Music Online: Popular Music Library
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: Contains a wide range of popular music from around the world, including millions of tracks from major genres in pop music, including alternative, country, Christian, electronic, hip-hop, metal, punk, new age, R&B, reggae, rock, soundtracks and many more.

children.name: Music Online: Reference
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Brings together a variety of essential music reference materials, spanning the entire history of Western classical music, including Baker’s Dictionary of Music, Baker’s Bibliographical Dictionary of Musicians, and Baker’s Student Encyclopedia of Music.

children.name: Music Online: Smithsonian Global Sound
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Produced in partnership with Smithsonian Folkways Recordings, is a virtual encyclopedia of the world's musical and aural traditions. The collection provides listeners with an unprecedented variety of online resources that support the creation, continuity, and preservation of diverse musical forms.

children.name: Naxos Music Library
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Naxos Music Library [NML] is the world´s largest online classical music library. New CDs are added to the library every month. The library offers the complete Naxos and Marco Polo catalogues plus the complete catalogues or selected titles from over 650 record label. Contents searched by composer, work, genre and label; by keyword and advanced search. NML provides liner notes for many recordings. Listeners can create personalized playlists or use predefined Naxos Music Library playlists.

children.name: Naxos Spoken Word Library
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Includes literature and poetry from medieval times to the twentieth century, and many newly written texts supplement an ever-expanding range of non-fiction.

children.name: Neue Pauly (Der)
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: The English edition of the authoritative Der Neue Pauly. In nearly 20,000 entries it covers two thousand years of history and culture of Greco-Roman Antiquity and the reception of this in the two thousand years that followed.

children.name: OmniFile Full Text Mega (H. W. Wilson)
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Contains support for research in all core undergraduate subjects and cross-disciplinary work. Contents includes: full text articles from over 2,500 publications (many of them peer-reviewed), dating back to 1994; indexing and abstracts from nearly 3,600 publications; full bibliographic citations to more than 13,000 dissertations or theses; and retrospective coverage as far back as 1982.

children.name: Oxford Art Online
children.subject: Digital Arts/Media|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: The authority on art from pre-history to present day. Includes: The Oxford Companion to Western Art; The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms; and the Encyclopedia of Aesthetics. Also articles about topics, bibliographies for further research, and thousands of searchable images made available through Oxford's partnerships with museums, galleries, and other outstanding arts organizations. Through a single, elegant gateway users can access—and simultaneously cross-search—an expanding range of Oxford’s acclaimed art reference works: Grove Art Online, the Benezit Dictionary of Artists, the Encyclopedia of Aesthetics, The Oxford Companion to Western Art, and The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms, as well as many specially commissioned articles and bibliographies available exclusively online.

children.name: Oxford Classical Dictionary
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: Covers all aspects of the classical world from literature and history to religion, science, and archaeology.  As well as providing factual information, the Dictionary contains many thematic entries on subjects relevant to the 21st century such as nationalism, race, gender, and ecology. Anthropology and reception have been added as new subject areas, covering topics such as creolization and kinship, as well as dance reception and translation.

children.name: Oxford English Dictionary
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Offers the best in etymological analysis, listings of variant spellings, and shows pronunciation using the International Phonetic Alphabet, tracing the evolution of more than 600,000 words over the last 1000 years through 3 million quotations from a wide range of sources.

children.name: Oxford Music Online
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: Oxford Music Online hosts Grove Music Online and other Oxford music reference works. Content includes: Grove Music Online; The Oxford Dictionary of Music; The Oxford Companion to Music; and Encyclopedia of Popular Music Oral History Online, and more.

children.name: Oxford Reference
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Brings together language and subject dictionaries and reference works into a single cross-searchable resource.

children.name: Periodicals Archive Online
children.subject: Anthropology|History|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Sociology|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Periodicals Archive Online spans the humanities and social sciences, across 37 key subject areas. It is international in scope with the inclusion of more than 150 foreign-language titles. Coverage is from volume 1 issue 1 of each journal and all issues are digitized from cover to cover. Union has access to Collection 1-3

children.name: Philosopher's Index
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: A current and comprehensive bibliographic database covering scholarly research in all major fields of philosophy. Contains research published since 1940 including over 680 journals from more than 50 countries with content representing a variety of languages.

children.name: PhilPapers
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: A comprehensive index and bibliography of philosophy research content maintained by the community of philosophers, including journals, books, open access archives, and personal pages maintained by academics. Also hosts the largest open access archive in philosophy. Classification is maintained by a combination of automatic, crowd-sourcing, and curation work done by appointed academics.

children.name: Poets on Screen
children.subject: English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: Poets On Screen contains video clip recordings of poets reading their own and other poets' work. Browse a list of poems read by contemporary poets; the poems can be viewed alphabetically by author/reader or by poem  title.

children.name: Project Muse
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|Government & Politics|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Humanities|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: Full-text of scholarly, peer-reviewed journals focusing on the fields of literature and criticism, history, the visual and performing arts, cultural studies, education, political science, gender studies, and many others. Browse by title or research area. 1995 to present.

children.name: ProQuest Newsstand
children.subject: History|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Offers access to the full text of over 1300 newspapers, news websites and blogs from leading publishers throughout the world. The database includes backfile for most newspapers, providing access to articles, columns, editorials, obituaries and features published in each paper. Major newspapers include the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Chicago Tribune, Washington Post, USA Today, Los Angeles Times, Boston Globe, The Guardian and more. Current local, regional and national news.

children.name: ProQuest Religion
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Primarily full-text, international periodicals for diverse religious and spiritual studies, covering formal theological studies of major religions, as well as the most recent trends and scholarly thought. More full-text journals have been added in related religious studies, such as philosophy, ethics, and international perspectives. Many essential full-text titles cannot be found in any other online database. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: ProQuest Research Library: History
children.subject: History|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Subject cover includes Civilizations, Historical studies, Military history, Periods & events, US history, and World history.

children.name: ProQuest Research Library: Literature & Language
children.subject: English & American Literature|Modern Languages|Humanities
children.desc: A sub-set of ProQuest Central, subject content includes World Literatures and Linguistics

children.name: RAMBI: The Index of Articles on Jewish Studies
children.subject: History|Humanities|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: A selective bibliography of academic articles covering all of the fields of Jewish studies. The articles listed are collected from thousands of journals, in print or electronic, from collections of articles and from offprints sent by researchers. RAMBI refers to articles in Hebrew, Latin or Cyrillic letters. The database is updated on a daily basis. Available in Hebrew or English.

children.name: Readers' Guide Full Text
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Readers' Guide Full Text includes indexing of over 450 periodicals as far back as 1983 and searchable full text of articles from over 250 journals as far back as 1994. PDF page images of full-text articles provide access to illustrations, photographs and other graphical content from the original article. All subject areas.

children.name: RILM Abstracts of Music Literature
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc:
Coverage spans 1967 to the present, updated monthly. Since its first publication in 1967, RILM has covered articles in over 10,000 journals, many of which are not specifically devoted to music. New records are added annually. Sound recordings and motion pictures that present the results of scholarly research or fieldwork are also included. RILM contains records in over 100 languages;
entries include original-language titles, title translations in English, full bibliographic information, and abstracts in English, as well as author, journal, and in-depth subject indexes.

children.name: Rock's Back Pages
children.subject: Music|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Classic articles on artists from Aaliyah to ZZ Top, on all genres from rockabilly to hip hop, by the finest music writers. The database contains an ever-expanding collection of primary-source, full-text music writing. Sourced from the pages of the music and mainstream press, it is a library of articles (reviews, interviews, features and more) from the early '60s up to present day and includes a growing collection of exclusive audio interviews.

children.name: Routledge Encyclopedia of Modernism
children.subject: Film Studies|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities|Literature|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Includes 1,000+ articles from experts in the field, supported by over 100 images. The content is fully cross-referenced and covers eight key subject areas: Literature, Architecture, Visual Arts, Music, Dance, Theatre, Film, and Intellectual Currents.

children.name: Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: Provides access to over 2,700 articles. Regularly updated with new and revised articles for further discovery and research, clearly organised and with over 25,000 cross-references linking themes, concepts and philosophers. An ideal reference source for subjects related to philosophy, such as politics, psychology, economics, anthropology, religion and literature.

children.name: Social and Cultural History: Letters and Diaries Online
children.subject: Africana Studies|American Studies|History|Humanities|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Includes thousands of private writings and personal narratives. With Black Thought & Culture; British & Irish Women's Letters and Diaries; American Civil War: Letters and Diaries; North American Immigrant Letters, Diaries and Oral Histories; North American Women's Letters and Diaries; and Oral History Online.

children.name: Social Science Research Network (SSRN)
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Composed of a number of specialized research networks in each of the social sciences. The SSRN eLibrary consists of two parts: an Abstract Database containing abstracts of scholarly working papers and forthcoming papers and an Electronic Paper Collection with downloadable full text documents in PDF format. The eLibrary also includes papers of a number of fee-based publications. Free individual registration required for full-text access.

children.name: South Carolina Newspapers - 1732-1780
children.subject: Africana Studies|History|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: This collection contains information on colonial and early American History and genealogy, and provides an accurate glimpse of life in South Carolina and America, with additional coverage of events in Europe, during the early days of this country. Includes the following: The South Carolina Gazette, 1732-1775; The Gazette of the State of South-Carolina, 1777-1780; The South Carolina Gazette & Country Journal, 1765-1775; The South Carolina & American General Gazette, 1777-1780; and The Gazette of the State of South-Carolina — 1777–1780.

children.name: Theatre in Video
children.subject: Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Theatre in Video contains performances of the world's leading plays, together with film documentaries. From celebrated productions of Shakespeare to rare, in-depth footage of the work of Samuel Beckett, the collection covers a wide range of 20th century theatre history. Interviews with directors, designers, writers, and actors, along with excerpts of live performances.

children.name: Thesaurus Linguae Graecae
children.subject: Classics|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: The project has collected and digitized most texts written in Greek from Homer (8 c. B.C.) to the fall of Byzantium in AD 1453 and beyond. Its goal is to create a comprehensive digital library of Greek literature from antiquity to the present era. note: users must now register for a personal account in order to gain access.

children.name: Twentieth-Century African-American Poetry
children.subject: Africana Studies|English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: A database of modern and contemporary African American poetry, featuring poems by the most important African American poets of the last century, including Langston Hughes, Jean Toomer, Imamu Amiri Baraka, Audre Lorde and Rita Dove.

children.name: Twentieth-Century American Poetry
children.subject: English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: Includes a unique survey of the movements, schools and distinctive voices of modern and contemporary American poetry. Major movements of the century are represented, including the Black Mountain school of Charles Olson and Robert Duncan, the Deep Image poetry of Robert Bly and James Wright, underground literature by the Beat poets, the influential feminist works of Adrienne Rich, and the works by the confessional poets. The entire text of each poem has been included.

children.name: Twentieth-Century English Poetry
children.subject: English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: A collection of more than 600 volumes of poetry by 283 poets from 1900 to the present day, including W.B. Yeats, Rudyard Kipling, Thomas Hardy, Wilfred Owen, Thom Gunn, Fleur Adcock, Paul Muldoon, Tony Harrison, Benjamin Zephaniah and Carol Ann Duffy, and incorporating the poets in The Faber Poetry Library. From modernist experiment to post-modern playfulness, from Georgian convention to free-verse confession, and from Edwardian poetry of empire to post-imperial diversity.

children.name: Underground and Independent Comics, Comix, and Graphic Novels
children.subject: English & American Literature|Sociology|Humanities
children.desc: Underground and Independent Comics is the first-ever scholarly online collection for researchers and students of adult comic books and graphic novels. Includes primary materials (the comics themselves), and materials about comics—interviews, commentary, theory, and criticism—from The Comics Journal and other secondary sources.

children.name: Virginia Gazette
children.subject: History|Political Science|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: The Virginia Gazette was the first newspaper published in Virginia and the first to be published in the area south of the Potomac River in the colonial period of the United States. Issues have the following subtitle: Containing the freshest advices, foreign and domestick. Published weekly in Williamsburg, Virginia between 1736 and 1780, The Virginia Gazette contained news covering all of Virginia and also included information from other colonies, Scotland, England and additional countries.  As Williamsburg was the center of growing tensions in the Virginia Colony which led to the American Revolution, the newspaper was one of the centers of activity in the capital of Virginia, and dutifully published accounts. When at the urging of Gov. Thomas Jefferson the capital was relocated to Richmond in 1780, the newspaper followed. The final issue of The Virginia Gazette produced in Williamsburg was April 8, 1780.

children.name: World Shakespeare Bibliography Online
children.subject: English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: The World Shakespeare Bibliography Online is a searchable electronic database consisting of the most comprehensive record of Shakespeare-related scholarship and theatrical productions published or produced worldwide between 1960 and 2016. It provides annotated entries for all important books, articles, book reviews,dissertations, theatrical productions, reviews of productions, audiovisual materials, electronic media, and other scholarly and popular materials related to Shakespeare.

children.name: Caribbean Newspapers 1718-1876
children.subject: Africana Studies|History|International Studies|Area Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc:
The largest collection of fully searchable 18th- and 19th-century Caribbean newspapers.
The evolution of the region across two centuries chronicled within more than 140 titles from 22 islands between 1718-1876.
Essential for research on colonial history, the Atlantic slave trade, international commerce, New World slavery and related topics.

children.name: CIAO (Columbia International Affairs Online )
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Columbia International Affairs Online (CIAO) is the most comprehensive source for theory and research in international affairs. It publishes a wide range of scholarship from 1991 onward that includes working papers from university research institutes, occasional papers series from NGOs, foundation-funded research projects, proceedings from conferences, books, journals and policy briefs. All sections of CIAO are updated monthly.

children.name: Confidential U.S. State Department Central Files, Africa and Middle East, 1960-1969
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Student demonstrations, political unrest, coup d'etats, assassinations, political trials, meetings and visits of foreign leaders, economic and agricultural assistance, disputes over the use of international waters, international trade, military conflicts are a sampling of documents included in this collection

children.name: Diversity Studies Collection
children.subject: Africana Studies|History|International Studies|Social Sciences|Area Studies|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Provides access to scholarly journals and magazines that explore cultural differences, contributions, and influences in the global community.

children.name: Europa World
children.subject: Economics|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Europa World is the online version of the Europa World Year Book, the indispensable source of information on world-wide affairs. First published in 1926, the year book is renowned as one of the world's leading reference works, covering political and economic information in over 250 countries and territories, from Afghanistan to Zimbabwe. Statistical data by country and directory contact details of nearly 2000 international organizations.

children.name: Handbook of Latin American Studies (HLAS) Online
children.subject: History|International Studies|Area Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: The Handbook is a bibliography on Latin America consisting of works selected and annotated by scholars. Edited by the Hispanic Division of the Library of Congress, the multidisciplinary Handbook alternates annually between the social sciences and the humanities.

children.name: Historical Abstracts with Full Text
children.subject: History|International Studies|Social Sciences|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: Historical Abstracts with Full Text is an exceptional resource that covers the history of the world (excluding the United States and Canada) from 1450 forward, including world history, military history, women's history, history of education, and much more. This authoritative database provides indexing of historical articles from more than 1,800 journals in over 40 languages back to 1955. Representing scholarship from more than 90 countries, the database includes book citations, dissertations and theses, and coverage extends to related disciplines such as archeology, anthropology and sociology. In addition to standard search features, Historical Abstracts with Full Text allows for searching by time period, a major advantage given the extensive range of its coverage. With over 800,000 records and access to the full text of more than 349 journals and more than 120 books, Historical Abstracts with Full Text is unmatched in its scope and breadth of historical and related social science literature.

children.name: Historical Statistics of the United States
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|Government & Politics|History|International Studies|Social Sciences|Statistics
children.desc: Download tables in Excel or CSV; also download entire groups of tables as a zip file; a compendium of statistics from over 1000 sources has been expanded to include over 37,000 data series.

children.name: Homeland Security Digital Library
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies|Law and Public Policy
children.desc: Resources in the Homeland Security Digital Library cover a wide range of homeland security topics and are carefully selected and evaluated by a team of librarians and content specialists. Sources include, but are not limited to: Federal, state and local governments; International governments and institutions; Nonprofit organizations and private sector entities; Think tanks, research centers, colleges and universities, and more. The Public Collection includes over 81,000 public domain items. Some highlighted sections: U.S. Policy and Strategy Documents related to homeland security; General U.S. Policy Documents, National Strategies, Executive Orders, Presidential Directives, and Key Legislation; Congressional Hearings and Legislation; CRS Reports & Issue Briefs; and GAO Reports & Testimony

children.name: International Women’s Movement: The Pan Pacific Southeast Asia Women’s Association of the USA
children.subject: Asian Studies|History|Sociology|International Studies|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Formerly known as the Pan Pacific Women’s Association of the U.S.A., the Pan Pacific and Southeast Asia Women’s Association was founded in 1930 to strengthen international understanding and friendship among the women of Asia and the Pacific and women of the U.S.A. Includes 9,921 images from 1938 to 2006.

children.name: Kanopy
children.subject: Film Studies|History|Visual Arts|Sociology|International Studies|Social Sciences|Area Studies|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Kanopy has more than 26,000 streaming films in its collection - including leading producers such as Criterion Collection, Universal Paramount, The Great Courses, New Day Films, California Newsreel, Kino Lorber, PBS, BBC, First Run Features, Media Education Foundation, Documentary Education Resources - on every topic imaginable.

children.name: MLA International Bibliography
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages|International Studies|Humanities
children.desc: Offers a detailed bibliography of journal articles, books and dissertations. This database includes journal abbreviations and acronyms for almost 3,500 titles, with full journal names standardized and ISSNs attached. MLA International Bibliography also contains nearly 11,000 subject names and terms. Includes a proprietary thesaurus used to assign descriptors to each record in the bibliography; and a proprietary, searchable directory of noted authors' names, with links to brief descriptive notes.

children.name: OxResearch
children.subject: Economics|Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Provides analytical articles covering world and regional economic and political developments of major significance. It evaluates issues and events within a coherent political, social and economic framework. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: ProQuest Military Collection
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Covers topics across all government and military branches, including international relations, political science, criminology, defense, aeronautics and space flight, communications, civil engineering, and more. It includes 550+ titles, with more than 400 available in full-text, dating back to the early 1990's. Deep backfile is available for a few select titles: Marine Corps Gazette dating back to 1916, Leatherneck dating back to 1921, and Foreign Affairs dating back to 1923.

children.name: ProQuest Political Science
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Access to hundreds of leading political science and international relations journals, providing full-text of many core titles indexed in Worldwide Political Science Abstracts. In addition, over a thousand recent full-text doctoral dissertations on political science topics are included, together with working papers, conference proceedings, country profiles, political news and other sources. Including such topics as comparative politics, political economy, international development, environmental policy, and hundreds of related topics. Coverage: 1985 - current

children.name: Social Sciences Full Text
children.subject: American Studies|Asian Studies|Education|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|International Studies|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Subject coverage includes addiction studies, anthropology, community health & medical care, communications, economics, environmental studies, ethics, family studies, gender studies, geography, international relations, law, mass media, minority studies, political science, psychiatry, psychology, public welfare, social work, urban studies and much more.

children.name: Statistical Insight
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: ProQuest Statistical Insight provides abstracting, indexing, and full text for publications from hundreds of public domain and licensed sources, including federal statistical publications; state government and business statistical reports; international statistical publications from the UN, OECD, EU, and more

children.name: Times of India: Historical Newspapers (1838 - 2005)
children.subject: Asian Studies|History|International Studies
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides users with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

children.name: Trade and Investment (IMF)
children.subject: Business|Economics|International Studies
children.desc: Part of the IMF eLibrary Data Resource. Build queries for specific countries, topic and source combinations to produce data sets on trade and investment.

children.name: Women in Politics Bibliographic Database
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|International Studies|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: This database contains bibliographic references on books and articles dealing with women in politics. Courtesy of the Inter-Parliamentary Union, it has been developed with the contribution of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

children.name: Women Organizing Transnationally: The Committee of Correspondence, 1952-1969
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Sociology|International Studies|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Provides a rich collection from which to explore gendered aspects of Cold War liberalism, the United States government’s clandestine and overt cultural propaganda operations, women’s relationships to US foreign policy, and the varied goals and methods of women’s international organizations that interacted in United Nations forums and at international conferences during the first two decades of the Cold War.  The records include extensive official correspondence as well as hundreds of letters to and from correspondents throughout the world documenting the work of the organization. In addition there are official records; minutes; complete files of multi-lingual publications entitled 'Community Action Series' and 'Meeting Community Needs;' miscellaneous publications; conferences and workshop material; oral history transcripts, 1988-89, with related biographical material and writings by individuals; and card files on individual participants, filed by country. The country files also contain published materials pertaining to the status and problems of the world’s women.

children.name: World Development Indicators
children.subject: Economics|International Studies
children.desc: World Development Indicators (WDI) publication is a collection of time-series data for 214 economies, with many indicators going back more than 50 years. WDI provides cross-country comparable statistics about development and people’s lives around the globe. It is divided into six sections -- World View, People, Environment, Economy, States and Markets, and Global Links.

children.name: Arts & Humanities Citation Index
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Part of the Web of Science database, a multidisciplinary database covering the journal literature of the arts and humanities, with cited references but not abstracts. Indexes 1,300+ of the world's leading arts and humanities journals, plus individually selected, relevant items from over 7,000 major science and social science journals. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: ATLA Religion Database with ATLASerials
children.subject: Classics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: ATLA Religion Database® (ATLA RDB®) with ATLASerials® (ATLAS®) combines the premier index to journal articles, book reviews, and collections of essays in all fields of religion with ATLA's online collection of major religion and theology journals. The ATLA Religion Database includes more than 620,000 article citations from more than 1,746 journals (575 currently indexed), more than 250,000 essay citations from over 18,000 multi-author works, more than 570,000 book review citations, and a growing number of multimedia citations. Coverage in this database begins in 1949 although indexing for some journal titles extends back into the nineteenth century. In ATLASerials, full text is provided for more than 380,000 electronic articles and book reviews from more than 220 journals selected by leading religion scholars in the United States. This database is produced by the American Theological Library Association.

children.name: Index to Jewish Periodicals
children.subject: Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Provides a comprehensive guide to English-language articles, book reviews, and feature stories in more than 230 journals devoted to Jewish affairs. Most references are not found in standard periodical literature guides. Index to Jewish Periodicals is intended for students of Jewish thought and others interested in contemporary Jewish and Middle Eastern affairs. Journal coverage dates back as far as 1988.

children.name: Jerusalem Post: Historical Newspapers (1932 - 2008)
children.subject: History|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides genealogists, researchers and scholars with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time, 1932 - 2008.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: ProQuest Religion
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Primarily full-text, international periodicals for diverse religious and spiritual studies, covering formal theological studies of major religions, as well as the most recent trends and scholarly thought. More full-text journals have been added in related religious studies, such as philosophy, ethics, and international perspectives. Many essential full-text titles cannot be found in any other online database. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: RAMBI: The Index of Articles on Jewish Studies
children.subject: History|Humanities|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: A selective bibliography of academic articles covering all of the fields of Jewish studies. The articles listed are collected from thousands of journals, in print or electronic, from collections of articles and from offprints sent by researchers. RAMBI refers to articles in Hebrew, Latin or Cyrillic letters. The database is updated on a daily basis. Available in Hebrew or English.

children.name: America: History and Life with Full Text
children.subject: Africana Studies|American Studies|History|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: America: History & Life with Full Text is the definitive database of literature covering the history and culture of the United States and Canada, from prehistory to the present. With selective indexing from 1964 to the present this database also provides full-text coverage of more than 196 journals and more than 92 books. Includes citations and links to book and media reviews, and searchable cited references are provided for key journals.

children.name: Caribbean Newspapers 1718-1876
children.subject: Africana Studies|History|International Studies|Area Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc:
The largest collection of fully searchable 18th- and 19th-century Caribbean newspapers.
The evolution of the region across two centuries chronicled within more than 140 titles from 22 islands between 1718-1876.
Essential for research on colonial history, the Atlantic slave trade, international commerce, New World slavery and related topics.

children.name: Handbook of Latin American Studies (HLAS) Online
children.subject: History|International Studies|Area Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: The Handbook is a bibliography on Latin America consisting of works selected and annotated by scholars. Edited by the Hispanic Division of the Library of Congress, the multidisciplinary Handbook alternates annually between the social sciences and the humanities.

children.name: Historical Abstracts with Full Text
children.subject: History|International Studies|Social Sciences|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: Historical Abstracts with Full Text is an exceptional resource that covers the history of the world (excluding the United States and Canada) from 1450 forward, including world history, military history, women's history, history of education, and much more. This authoritative database provides indexing of historical articles from more than 1,800 journals in over 40 languages back to 1955. Representing scholarship from more than 90 countries, the database includes book citations, dissertations and theses, and coverage extends to related disciplines such as archeology, anthropology and sociology. In addition to standard search features, Historical Abstracts with Full Text allows for searching by time period, a major advantage given the extensive range of its coverage. With over 800,000 records and access to the full text of more than 349 journals and more than 120 books, Historical Abstracts with Full Text is unmatched in its scope and breadth of historical and related social science literature.

children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies|Law and Public Policy
children.desc: Resources in the Homeland Security Digital Library cover a wide range of homeland security topics and are carefully selected and evaluated by a team of librarians and content specialists. Sources include, but are not limited to: Federal, state and local governments; International governments and institutions; Nonprofit organizations and private sector entities; Think tanks, research centers, colleges and universities, and more. The Public Collection includes over 81,000 public domain items. Some highlighted sections: U.S. Policy and Strategy Documents related to homeland security; General U.S. Policy Documents, National Strategies, Executive Orders, Presidential Directives, and Key Legislation; Congressional Hearings and Legislation; CRS Reports & Issue Briefs; and GAO Reports & Testimony

children.name: Making Of Modern Law: Trials 1600-1926
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Criminal Justice|Law and Public Policy
children.desc: Includes trials from the collection of the Library of the Association of Bar of the City of New York, as well as some from the British Library.

children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: Physics - arXiv.org

Current I&A of a selected set of physics, mathematical and statistical physics, astronomy, astrophysics, and geophysics journals; PubMed/Medline; and Scitopia - 'a vertical search portal' with access to peer-reviewed journal articles, proceedings papers, standards, patents, and government reports.

children.name: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics Journals (SIAM)
children.subject: Mathematics
children.desc:
A collection of ejournals from the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics. Journals focused on fields related to industrial and applied mathematics - 1997 to present.
Look for full-text symbol.

children.name: Springer Link
children.subject: Mathematics|Statistics
children.desc: Providing researchers with access to millions of scientific documents from journals, books, series, protocols and reference works.

children.name: Web of Science
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Environmental Science|Physics|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: Includes ISI Science Citation Index 1997-present; Social Sciences Citation Index, 1997-present; and Arts & Humanities Citation Index, 1997-present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) Digital Collection
children.subject: Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides online access to select technical journals of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) and to ASME conference papers.

children.name: Applied Science & Technology Full Text
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media|Environmental Science|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience
children.desc: Applied Science & Technology Full Text™ contains indexing and abstracts for nearly 800 core English-language, scientific and technical publications back to 1983. Full text of articles is available from more than 220 periodicals dating back to 1997, including page images that provide access to original illustrations, charts and photographs. Content includes coverage of a wide variety of applied science specialties—acoustics to aeronautics, neural networks to nuclear and civil engineering, computers and informatics and much more—from leading trade and industrial journals, professional and technical society journals, specialized subject periodicals, buyers’ guides, directories and conference proceedings.

children.name: IEEE Xplore Digital Library
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to full-text from some of the world's most highly cited publications in electrical engineering, computer science and electronics. The content comprises journals, conference proceedings, technical standards, eBooks and educational courses. Covers material published since 1988 with select content published since 1950.

children.name: Inspec
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Physics|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to the world's scientific and technical literature in physics, electrical engineering, electronics, communications, control engineering, computers and computing, and information technology. Dates of coverage: 1969 through the present.

children.name: Science Citation Index
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mechanical Engineering|Bioethics|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the sciences. With cited references from 1997 to the present. Includes new cited references to patents per week. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Artfl Project
children.subject: History|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: Founded in 1982 the ARTFL Project is a consortium-based service that provides its members with access to North America's largest collection of digitized French resources.

children.name: Arts & Humanities Citation Index
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Part of the Web of Science database, a multidisciplinary database covering the journal literature of the arts and humanities, with cited references but not abstracts. Indexes 1,300+ of the world's leading arts and humanities journals, plus individually selected, relevant items from over 7,000 major science and social science journals. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Contemporary Literary Criticism
children.subject: English & American Literature|Modern Languages
children.desc: Contemporary Literary Criticism (CLC) is the world's leading resource for information on modern literature. Since the appearance of the first volume of CLC in 1973, researchers have grown to depend on this reference work for timely critical analysis of key literary works. CLC Select presents significant published criticism on the works of novelists, poets, playwrights, short story writers, and other creative writers now living or who died after January 1, 2000.Each entry contains the following: a biographical essay that discusses the author's life, works, and critical importance; critical essays or excerpts taken from books, magazines, literary reviews, newspapers, and scholarly journals; and, where available, interviews with featured authors. A complete bibliographical citation prefaces each critical essay and most essays are introduced by a brief annotation that establishes a context and purpose for the criticism. Entries also provide suggestions for further reading.

children.name: Humanities Full Text
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Humanities Full Text includes many of the most important academic journals in the humanities with the full text of articles from over 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, and high-quality indexing for almost 700 journals—of which 470 are peer-reviewed—dating as far back as 1984. The database provides coverage of feature articles, interviews, bibliographies, obituaries, and original works of fiction, drama, poetry and book reviews, as well as reviews of ballets, dance programs, motion pictures, musicals, radio and television programs, plays, operas, and more. Topics covered include classical studies, literary & social criticism, philosophy, religion & theology, literature, art, dance, film, folklore, music, performing arts, area studies, communications, gender studies, history, journalism, linguistics, archaeology, and much more.

children.name: Literature Online
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages
children.desc: A leading online resource for the study and teaching of literature in English. It is a fully integrated service that combines the texts of over 355,000 literary works with a vast library of key criticism and reference resources. Includes full-text journals and author biographies.

children.name: Literature Resource Center
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Modern Languages
children.desc: Reliable online resource for research on literary topics, authors, and their works. Its coverage includes all genres and disciplines, all time periods, and all regions of the world. Provides access to biographies, bibliographies, and critical analyses of authors from every age and literary discipline. Covers novelists, essayist, poets, journalists, and other writers, with in-depth coverage of the most-studied authors.

children.name: MLA International Bibliography
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages|International Studies|Humanities
children.desc: Offers a detailed bibliography of journal articles, books and dissertations. This database includes journal abbreviations and acronyms for almost 3,500 titles, with full journal names standardized and ISSNs attached. MLA International Bibliography also contains nearly 11,000 subject names and terms. Includes a proprietary thesaurus used to assign descriptors to each record in the bibliography; and a proprietary, searchable directory of noted authors' names, with links to brief descriptive notes.

children.name: PressReader
children.subject: Modern Languages
children.desc: Provides online access to today's newspapers from around the world in full-color, full-page format. The ever-expanding collection currently includes over 5000+ newspapers and magazines from 100 countries in 60 languages. Viewers can browse articles and other key content, such as pictures, advertisements, classifieds, and notices. Includes a 60-day backfile and the ability to perform keyword searches within any issue.

children.name: Project Muse: Languages & Literature
children.subject: Modern Languages
children.desc: A sub-collection of Project Muse journal titles with a focus on Languages & Literature.

children.name: ProQuest Research Library: Literature & Language
children.subject: English & American Literature|Modern Languages|Humanities
children.desc: A sub-set of ProQuest Central, subject content includes World Literatures and Linguistics

children.name: Thesaurus Linguae Graecae
children.subject: Classics|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: The project has collected and digitized most texts written in Greek from Homer (8 c. B.C.) to the fall of Byzantium in AD 1453 and beyond. Its goal is to create a comprehensive digital library of Greek literature from antiquity to the present era. note: users must now register for a personal account in order to gain access.

children.name: Arts & Humanities Citation Index
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies

Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: DRAM: Database of Recorded American Music
children.subject: Music
children.desc:
DRAM is a not-for-profit resource providing educational communities with on-demand streaming access to CD-quality audio,complete original liner notes and essays from independent record labels, and
sound archives. Currently DRAM's collection contains nearly 4,000 albums worth of recordings from a distinctive set of 42 independent labels, from folk to opera, Native American to jazz, 19th century classical to early rock, musical theater, contemporary, electronic and beyond. New labels being added on a regular basis. Their primary focus is the preservation and dissemination of important recordings that have been neglected by the commercial marketplace, recordings that may otherwise become lost or forgotten.

children.name: Fine Arts and Music Collection
children.subject: Film Studies|Music|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: Fine Arts and Music Collection provides access to scholarly journals and magazines that support research in areas including drama, music, art history, and filmmaking.

children.name: Humanities Full Text
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics|Theater and Dance

children.name: Music Online: American Music
children.subject: American Studies|History|Music
children.desc: American Song includes songs by and about American Indians, miners, immigrants, slaves, children, pioneers and cowboys. Included in the database are the songs of Civil Rights, political campaigns, Prohibition, the Revolutionary War, the Civil War, anti-war protests and more. It's keyword searchable or browsable by title, genre, instruments, performers or ensembles, events or publishers

children.name: Music Online: Classical Music Library
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc:
Currently provides streaming access to classical works that can be browsed by composer and the results sorted by title, date of composition and genre.
More than 400 distinct instrument categories.

children.name: Music Online: Classical Music Library
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance
children.desc: Classical Music Library is an award-winning, comprehensive streaming audio collection of classical music. It currently provides streaming access to more than 958,830 tracks, including almost 60,000 recordings from EMI, and is growing monthly as new recordings are added. More than 25,000 unique classical works that can be browsed by composer and the results sorted by title, date of composition and genre. More than 400 distinct instrument categories. More than 150 distinct classical genres and sub-genres. Data on more than 10,000 individual composers and 100,000s of artists and ensembles.

children.name: Music Online: Classical Music Reference Library

Included are the authoritative reference titles Baker's Dictionary of Music, Baker's Biographical Dictionary of Musicians, and Baker's Student Encyclopedia of Music, which are available for the first time in electronic form. There is access to: 30,124 books and documents (79,739 pages).

children.name: Music Online: Classical Scores Library vol. 1
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc:
Classical Scores Library: Volume I is the largest and most comprehensive online scores database designed to support the teaching and research of classical music. It provides online access to more than 25,000 scores and nearly 440,000 pages that can be printed and annotated. All major genres and time periods from medieval to contemporary, from choral works to symphonies, operas, and the avant-garde.
All major score types: full score, study score, piano score, and vocal score.

children.name: Music Online: Classical Scores Library, Volume 1
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: A series of three volumes contains the most important classical music scores, manuscripts, and previously unpublished material, allowing for the study and analysis of musical scores. With full, study, piano, and vocal scores.

children.name: Music Online: Contemporary World Music
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: With nearly 155,000 albums and 1,931,837 tracks, Contemporary World Music delivers the sounds of all regions from every continent. The database contains important genres such as reggae, worldbeat, neo-traditional, world fusion, Balkanic jazz, African film, Bollywood, Arab swing and jazz, and other genres such as traditional music - Indian classical, fado, flamenco, klezmer, zydeco, gospel, gagaku, and more. Searchable by genre, places, performers, cultural groups, instruments, or titles.

children.name: Music Online: Contemporary World Music
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: Delivers the sounds of all regions from every continent.

children.name: Music Online: Garland Encyclopedia of World Music
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: More than 10,000 pages of material, combined with entries by more than 700 expert contributors from all over the world, make this the most complete body of work focused on world music. This release includes 1,210 essays and images from 10 sources and hundreds of audio examples

children.name: Music Online: Jazz Music Library
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities

children.name: Music Online: Listening
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: A multidisciplinary collection of audiovisual content that touches on the curriculum needs of virtually every department. This collection allows students and researchers to analyze unique and valuable content from over 500 producers and distributors around the world.

children.name: Music Online: Opera in Video
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: A comprehensive collection of operatic performances covering the most commonly studied operas in music history, opera literature, and performance classes. Multiple productions of the most studied operas allow for comparative analysis, showing various interpretations of staging/set design. Interviews with singers, stage designers, and directors, integrated with excerpts of live performances.

children.name: Music Online: Popular Music Library
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: Contains a wide range of popular music from around the world, including millions of tracks from major genres in pop music, including alternative, country, Christian, electronic, hip-hop, metal, punk, new age, R&B, reggae, rock, soundtracks and many more.

children.name: Music Online: Reference
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Brings together a variety of essential music reference materials, spanning the entire history of Western classical music, including Baker’s Dictionary of Music, Baker’s Bibliographical Dictionary of Musicians, and Baker’s Student Encyclopedia of Music.

children.name: Music Online: Smithsonian Global Sound
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Produced in partnership with Smithsonian Folkways Recordings, is a virtual encyclopedia of the world's musical and aural traditions. The collection provides listeners with an unprecedented variety of online resources that support the creation, continuity, and preservation of diverse musical forms.

children.name: Naxos Music Library
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Naxos Music Library [NML] is the world´s largest online classical music library. New CDs are added to the library every month. The library offers the complete Naxos and Marco Polo catalogues plus the complete catalogues or selected titles from over 650 record label. Contents searched by composer, work, genre and label; by keyword and advanced search. NML provides liner notes for many recordings. Listeners can create personalized playlists or use predefined Naxos Music Library playlists.

children.name: Oxford Music Online
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: Oxford Music Online hosts Grove Music Online and other Oxford music reference works. Content includes: Grove Music Online; The Oxford Dictionary of Music; The Oxford Companion to Music; and Encyclopedia of Popular Music Oral History Online, and more.

children.name: RILM Abstracts of Music Literature
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc:
Coverage spans 1967 to the present, updated monthly. Since its first publication in 1967, RILM has covered articles in over 10,000 journals, many of which are not specifically devoted to music. New records are added annually. Sound recordings and motion pictures that present the results of scholarly research or fieldwork are also included. RILM contains records in over 100 languages;
entries include original-language titles, title translations in English, full bibliographic information, and abstracts in English, as well as author, journal, and in-depth subject indexes.

children.name: Rock's Back Pages
children.subject: Music|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Classic articles on artists from Aaliyah to ZZ Top, on all genres from rockabilly to hip hop, by the finest music writers. The database contains an ever-expanding collection of primary-source, full-text music writing. Sourced from the pages of the music and mainstream press, it is a library of articles (reviews, interviews, features and more) from the early '60s up to present day and includes a growing collection of exclusive audio interviews.
