children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: Combines the clinical research titles available in ProQuest Medical Library with hundreds of additional consumer and health administration titles.

children.name: ProQuest Psychology
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: Abstracts and indexing for more than 650 titles, with over 540 titles available in full text. Users get access to charts, diagrams, graphs, tables, photos, and other graphical elements essential to psychological research. Additionally, the database includes 4,000 full text dissertations representing a range of psychology disciplines. Many titles are indexed in PsycINFO.

children.name: ProQuest Research Library
children.subject: Political Science|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Provides one-stop access to a wide range of popular academic subjects, from 1971 forward. It features a diversified mix of scholarly journals, trade publications, magazines, and newspapers. ProQuest Research Library is designed to cover the top 150 core academic subject reference areas.

children.name: ProQuest Science and Technology
children.subject: Engineering|Biology|Environmental Science|Geology|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Includes access to ProQuest Science and Technology databases. BioOne Abstracts, Pollution Abstracts, Biology Journals, Applied and General Science journals, and more.

children.name: PsycARTICLES
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Full-text, peer-reviewed scholarly and scientific articles in psychology. It contains articles from journals published by the American Psychological Association (APA), and others. Coverage spans 1894 to present; Indexed with controlled vocabulary from APA's Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms.

children.name: PsycINFO
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Contains over 3 million citations and summaries of journal articles, book chapters, books, dissertations and technical reports. Ninety-nine percent of its content is peer-reviewed. Journal coverage spans from the 1800s to the present. PsycINFO is indexed with controlled vocabulary from APA's Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms.

children.name: PubMed Central
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: PubMed Central is a free archive of biomedical and life sciences journal literature at the U.S. National Institutes of Health's National Library of Medicine (NIH/NLM). In addition to its role as an archive, the value of PMC lies in its capacity to store and cross-reference data from diverse sources using a common format within a single repository.

children.name: PubMed
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: PubMed comprises citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. Citations and abstracts include the fields of biomedicine and health, covering portions of the life sciences, behavioral sciences, chemical sciences, and bioengineering. PubMed also provides access to additional relevant web sites and links to the other NCBI molecular biology resources.

children.name: q-bio (Quantitative Biology)
children.subject: Biology|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: The Quantitative Biology section of arXiv, an archive of electronic (p)reprints in quantitative biology with coverage from 2003.

children.name: Royal Society of Chemistry
children.subject: Biochemistry|Chemistry|Natural Sciences
children.desc:
The Royal Society of Chemistry produces 13 primary and four review journals covering all branches of chemistry, including inorganic chemistry, organic chemistry, analytical chemistry, physical chemistry and chemical physics. Site-wide access to: The Analyst, Chemical Communications, Chemical Society Reviews, Dalton Transactions, Faraday Discussions, Faraday Transactions, Perkin 1, Perkin 2,
Physical Chemistry Chemical Physics. Searchable index.

children.name: Science Citation Index
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mechanical Engineering|Bioethics|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the sciences. With cited references from 1997 to the present. Includes new cited references to patents per week. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Science
children.subject: Natural Sciences
children.desc:
Includes access to Science: 1997-current issue; ScienceNOW; Science of Aging Knowledge Environment Archive; All Free Content on the site: Science, Science Classic, Science Signaling, SAGE KE Table of Contents of current issues and back issues. Emphasis is on material pertaining to the
interactions among science, technology, government, and society. Topical coverage includes the physical, biological, and social
sciences. Science also includes book reviews, editorial and letters sections, policy forums, perspectives, and information about new techniques and instrumentation.



Science includes the following topics: AIDS/HIV,
anthropology, apoptosis, astronomy, atmospheres,
biochemistry. biomedicine, biophysics, botany, cancer, cell
biology, computers and math, chemistry, developmental
biology, DNA/RNA events, ecology, engineering, epidemiology,
evolution, genetics, geochemistry, geophysics, immunology,
integrative physiology, materials science, microbiology,
neuroscience, oceans, paleontology, physics, planetary
science, psychology and behavior, science policy, signal
transduction, social sciences, and structural biology.

children.name: ScienceDirect
children.subject: Biology|Chemistry|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Access to the current and previous four years of journal articles and book chapters from nearly 2,500 journals and more than 30,000 books through the ScienceDirect Freedom Collection.

children.name: Scitation (AIP)
children.subject: Physics|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Astronomy
children.desc: Scitation includes search access to AIP's online journal service; SPIN (Searchable Physics Information Notices). Current I&A of a selected set of physics, mathematical and statistical physics, astronomy, astrophysics, and geophysics journals; PubMed/Medline; and Scitopia - 'a vertical search portal' with access to peer-reviewed journal articles, proceedings papers, standards, patents, and government reports.

children.name: Web of Science
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Environmental Science|Physics|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: Includes ISI Science Citation Index 1997-present; Social Sciences Citation Index, 1997-present; and Arts & Humanities Citation Index, 1997-present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Annual Reviews
children.subject: Physics|Psychology|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: Annual Reviews articles: (1) Capture current understanding of a topic, including what is well supported and what is controversial. (2) Set the work in historical context. (3) Highlight the major questions that remain to be addressed and the likely course of research in upcoming years. (4) Outline the practical applications and general significance of research to society.

children.name: Applied Science & Technology Full Text
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Digital Arts/Media|Environmental Science|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience
children.desc: Applied Science & Technology Full Text™ contains indexing and abstracts for nearly 800 core English-language, scientific and technical publications back to 1983. Full text of articles is available from more than 220 periodicals dating back to 1997, including page images that provide access to original illustrations, charts and photographs. Content includes coverage of a wide variety of applied science specialties—acoustics to aeronautics, neural networks to nuclear and civil engineering, computers and informatics and much more—from leading trade and industrial journals, professional and technical society journals, specialized subject periodicals, buyers’ guides, directories and conference proceedings.

children.name: BioMed Central
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Neuroscience
children.desc: BioMed Central is an STM (Science, Technology and Medicine) publisher of 287 peer-reviewed open access journals. The portfolio of journals spans all areas of biology, biomedicine and medicine and includes broad interest titles, such as BMC Biology and BMC Medicine alongside specialist journals, such as Retrovirology and BMC Genomics. All original research articles published by BioMed Central are made freely accessible online immediately upon publication.

children.name: BIOSIS Previews
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Neuroscience
children.desc: BIOSIS Previews contains the references to journal literature from Biological Abstracts, the references to meetings, reports, review articles, books and monographs from Biological Abstracts/RRM, as well as some unique references. Coverage extends from 1993 to the present.

children.name: Neurology Collection
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology|Neuroscience
children.desc: Updated regularly, this comprehensive online neurology resource covers the entire spectrum of neurology from the basics to specialty-specific content – optimized for viewing on any device. Includes texts, multimedia, and more.

children.name: ProQuest Psychology
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: Abstracts and indexing for more than 650 titles, with over 540 titles available in full text. Users get access to charts, diagrams, graphs, tables, photos, and other graphical elements essential to psychological research. Additionally, the database includes 4,000 full text dissertations representing a range of psychology disciplines. Many titles are indexed in PsycINFO.

children.name: q-bio (Quantitative Biology)
children.subject: Biology|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: The Quantitative Biology section of arXiv, an archive of electronic (p)reprints in quantitative biology with coverage from 2003.

children.name: Science Citation Index
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mechanical Engineering|Bioethics|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the sciences. With cited references from 1997 to the present. Includes new cited references to patents per week. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Web of Science
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Environmental Science|Physics|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: Includes ISI Science Citation Index 1997-present; Social Sciences Citation Index, 1997-present; and Arts & Humanities Citation Index, 1997-present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Artfl Project
children.subject: History|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: Founded in 1982 the ARTFL Project is a consortium-based service that provides its members with access to North America's largest collection of digitized French resources.

children.name: Arts & Humanities Citation Index
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Part of the Web of Science database, a multidisciplinary database covering the journal literature of the arts and humanities, with cited references but not abstracts. Indexes 1,300+ of the world's leading arts and humanities journals, plus individually selected, relevant items from over 7,000 major science and social science journals. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Humanities Full Text
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Humanities Full Text includes many of the most important academic journals in the humanities with the full text of articles from over 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, and high-quality indexing for almost 700 journals—of which 470 are peer-reviewed—dating as far back as 1984. The database provides coverage of feature articles, interviews, bibliographies, obituaries, and original works of fiction, drama, poetry and book reviews, as well as reviews of ballets, dance programs, motion pictures, musicals, radio and television programs, plays, operas, and more. Topics covered include classical studies, literary & social criticism, philosophy, religion & theology, literature, art, dance, film, folklore, music, performing arts, area studies, communications, gender studies, history, journalism, linguistics, archaeology, and much more.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: L'anne philologique
children.subject: Classics|History|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: A specialized bibliographic database of scholarly works relating to all aspects of ancient Greek and Roman civilizations. Its subjects are Greek and Latin literature and linguistics, including early Christian texts and patristics, Greek and Roman history, art, archaeology, philosophy, religion, mythology, music, science, and scholarly sub-specialties such as numismatics, papyrology and epigraphy.

children.name: Philosopher's Index
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: A current and comprehensive bibliographic database covering scholarly research in all major fields of philosophy. Contains research published since 1940 including over 680 journals from more than 50 countries with content representing a variety of languages.

children.name: PhilPapers
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: A comprehensive index and bibliography of philosophy research content maintained by the community of philosophers, including journals, books, open access archives, and personal pages maintained by academics. Also hosts the largest open access archive in philosophy. Classification is maintained by a combination of automatic, crowd-sourcing, and curation work done by appointed academics.

children.name: Project Muse
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|Government & Politics|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Humanities|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: Full-text of scholarly, peer-reviewed journals focusing on the fields of literature and criticism, history, the visual and performing arts, cultural studies, education, political science, gender studies, and many others. Browse by title or research area. 1995 to present.

children.name: ProQuest Health and Medical Complete
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: Combines the clinical research titles available in ProQuest Medical Library with hundreds of additional consumer and health administration titles.

children.name: ProQuest Religion
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Primarily full-text, international periodicals for diverse religious and spiritual studies, covering formal theological studies of major religions, as well as the most recent trends and scholarly thought. More full-text journals have been added in related religious studies, such as philosophy, ethics, and international perspectives. Many essential full-text titles cannot be found in any other online database. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: PubMed
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: PubMed comprises citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. Citations and abstracts include the fields of biomedicine and health, covering portions of the life sciences, behavioral sciences, chemical sciences, and bioengineering. PubMed also provides access to additional relevant web sites and links to the other NCBI molecular biology resources.

children.name: Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: Provides access to over 2,700 articles. Regularly updated with new and revised articles for further discovery and research, clearly organised and with over 25,000 cross-references linking themes, concepts and philosophers. An ideal reference source for subjects related to philosophy, such as politics, psychology, economics, anthropology, religion and literature.

children.name: Thesaurus Linguae Graecae
children.subject: Classics|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities
children.desc: The project has collected and digitized most texts written in Greek from Homer (8 c. B.C.) to the fall of Byzantium in AD 1453 and beyond. Its goal is to create a comprehensive digital library of Greek literature from antiquity to the present era. note: users must now register for a personal account in order to gain access.

children.name: Annual Reviews
children.subject: Physics|Psychology|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: Annual Reviews articles: (1) Capture current understanding of a topic, including what is well supported and what is controversial. (2) Set the work in historical context. (3) Highlight the major questions that remain to be addressed and the likely course of research in upcoming years. (4) Outline the practical applications and general significance of research to society.

children.name: APS Journals
children.subject: Physics
children.desc: Physical Review Letters, Physical Review X, Physical Review, and Reviews of Modern Physics

children.name: General Science Full Text
children.subject: Biology|Chemistry|Environmental Science|Geology|Physics|Natural Sciences|Astronomy
children.desc: General Science Full Text™ Indexes general science literature from the United States and Europe and provides full text from more than 100 periodicals dating as far back as 1995, in addition to indexing and abstracts for nearly 300 periodicals back to 1984. Subject coverage includes astronomy, biology, botany, chemistry, conservation, health & medicine, oceanography, physics, zoology and much more. It describes biographical sketches, symposia, conferences, review articles, selected letters to the editor, special issues of journals published as supplementary issues, review issues, laboratory guides, and book reviews.

children.name: Handbook of Chemistry & Physics Online
children.subject: Chemistry|Physics
children.desc: Access the latest edition of the CRC Handbook of Chemistry & Physics. Includes Text, Structure/Property and Chemical search options. Sections in this edition includes; Mathematics, Properties and Physical Constants, Chemical Tables, Properties of Matter, Heat, Hygrometric and Barometric Tables, Sound, Quantities and Units, and Miscellaneous. The ultimate book of facts about chemistry and physics. This is a book that covers virtually every element, every physical formula, and every mathematical table imaginable and puts physical formulas and mathematical tables used in labs every day within easy reach.

children.name: Inspec
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Physics|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to the world's scientific and technical literature in physics, electrical engineering, electronics, communications, control engineering, computers and computing, and information technology. Dates of coverage: 1969 through the present.

children.name: IOPscience
children.subject: Physics
children.desc: Includes institutional subscription access as well as Open Access titles.

children.name: Physics - arXiv.org
children.subject: Computer Science|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mathematics
children.desc: Electronic archive and distribution server for research articles. It provides open access to e-prints in Physics.

children.name: Science Citation Index
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mechanical Engineering|Bioethics|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the sciences. With cited references from 1997 to the present. Includes new cited references to patents per week. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Scitation (AIP)
children.subject: Physics|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Astronomy
children.desc: Scitation includes search access to AIP's online journal service; SPIN (Searchable Physics Information Notices). Current I&A of a selected set of physics, mathematical and statistical physics, astronomy, astrophysics, and geophysics journals; PubMed/Medline; and Scitopia - 'a vertical search portal' with access to peer-reviewed journal articles, proceedings papers, standards, patents, and government reports.

children.name: Web of Science
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Environmental Science|Physics|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: Includes ISI Science Citation Index 1997-present; Social Sciences Citation Index, 1997-present; and Arts & Humanities Citation Index, 1997-present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: America in Protest: Records of Anti-Vietnam War Organizations, The Vietnam Veterans Against the War
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc:
Date Range: 1967-1975
This publication consists of FBI reports dealing with every aspect of antiwar work carried out by the Vietnam Veterans Against the War (VVAW) which started in 1967 with six Vietnam veterans marching for peace in New York City. The purpose of the organization was to give voice to the returning servicemen who opposed the on-going war in Southeast Asia. The ranks of the membership eventually grew to over 30,000. The collection also includes surveillance on a variety of other antiwar groups and individuals, with an emphasis on student groups and Communist organizations.

children.name: American History in Video
children.subject: American Studies|History|Political Science
children.desc: American History in Video collection allows students and researchers to analyze historical events, and their presentation over time, through commercial and governmental newsreels, archival footage, public affairs footage, and important documentaries. Keyword searching or browsing by events, people or places.

children.name: American State Papers, 1789-1838
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc:
Consists of legislative and executive documents, many originating from the important period between 1789 and the beginning of the U.S. Congressional Serial Set in 1817.
Approximately two-thirds of the publications cover the first 14 Congresses (1789-1817), whereas the remaining third chronologically overlap with the Serial Set from 1817-1838.

children.name: Archives Unbound
children.subject: Africana Studies|American Studies|Government & Politics|History|English & American Literature|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc:
Archives Unbound presents topically-focused digital collections of historical documents. Search across all collections or browse
the 17 individual collections. Free index to all collections included.

children.name: CIAO (Columbia International Affairs Online )
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Columbia International Affairs Online (CIAO) is the most comprehensive source for theory and research in international affairs. It publishes a wide range of scholarship from 1991 onward that includes working papers from university research institutes, occasional papers series from NGOs, foundation-funded research projects, proceedings from conferences, books, journals and policy briefs. All sections of CIAO are updated monthly.

children.name: Confidential U.S. State Department Central Files, Africa and Middle East, 1960-1969
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Student demonstrations, political unrest, coup d'etats, assassinations, political trials, meetings and visits of foreign leaders, economic and agricultural assistance, disputes over the use of international waters, international trade, military conflicts are a sampling of documents included in this collection

children.name: Congressional Universe (Now ProQuest Congressional)
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: The Congressional Basic Subscription covers abstracts and indexing for Hearings, Reports, Documents and Committee prints from 1970-present (there are links to HTML text from approximately the mid-1990s) The Congressional basic subscription also covers bill tracking & profiles, bill text, members and committee coverage, the Daily Congressional Record and the Code of Federal Regulations and Federal Register, and political news.

children.name: Contemporary Women's Issues
children.subject: Political Science|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Contemporary Women's Issues (CWI), a multidisciplinary, full- text database brings together relevant content from mainstream periodicals, 'gray' literature, and the alternative press -- with a focus on the critical issues and events that influence women's lives in more than 190 countries. Contemporary Women's Issues includes English- language titles from East and West Africa, Asia, and South and Central America, the Caribbean, North America and Europe.

children.name: CQ Press Library
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|Political Science
children.desc: CQ Press Library - the place to search or browse resources on American government, current affairs, history, politics, public policy, and data analysis for the social sciences. Search across CQ Researcher, CQ Supreme Court Collection, and the online version of the CQ Weekly, offering complete coverage of Capitol Hill.CQ Press Library includes the online version of the award-winning CQ Researcher, the choice of librarians and researchers for more than ninety years. It features a newly added US Political Stats – an interactive tool for data on US Politics and State Stats - an interactive tool for state data in the social sciences. Also available are four subject-specific reference databases: Congress Collection, Supreme Court Collection, Public Affairs Collection, and Voting and Elections Collection, each a destination of its own. With enhanced content and advanced search functionality, CQ Press Library offers online editions of four essential reference books: CQ Almanac, Political Handbook of the World, Politics in America,and Supreme Court Yearbook. CQ Press Library also includes the foundational reference resource, CQ Press Encyclopedia of American Government; and an online version of CQ Weekly, offering complete coverage of Capitol Hill.

children.name: CQ Researcher
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|Political Science
children.desc: CQ Researcher provides award winning in-depth coverage of the most important issues of the day. Reports are written by experienced journalists, footnoted and professionally fact-checked. Full-length articles include an overview, historical background, chronology, pro/con feature, plus resources for additional research. Graphics, photos and short 'sidebar' features round out the reports. Shorter 'Hot Topics' articles provide a solid introduction to subjects most in demand by students. CQ Researcher Online offers access to CQ Researcher reports dating back ten years. PDF files are available for reports from January 1996; color PDFs are available for reports published after January 2001.Founded in 1923 as Editorial Research Reports, CQ Researcher is noted for its in-depth, unbiased coverage of health, social trends, criminal justice, international affairs, education, the environment, technology and the economy. Reports are published in print and online 44 times a year by CQ Press, an imprint of SAGE Publications.

children.name: CQ Supreme Court Collection
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|Political Science
children.desc: CQ Supreme Court Collection blends historical analysis with timely updates and expert commentary of Supreme Court decisions, biographies of Supreme Court justices, Supreme Court institutional history, and the U.S. Constitution. Users can access information by topic, justice, and case name. This collection includes summaries and analysis of more than four thousand major decisions, including all cases in which the Burger, Rehnquist, and Roberts Courts (October 1969 to the present) issued a written opinion, and links to the full text of the cases. Also Cases-in-Context — a selection of contemporary and controversial topics that are of enduring interest to researchers, including the death penalty, privacy, and free speech, and Key Cases — cases designated by the CQ Press editorial staff as the most important in American constitutional and political history. Not to mention statistics and other data on essential topics, such as the quantitative analysis of voting records, opinion alignments, and political alignments.

children.name: CQ Weekly
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|Political Science
children.desc: The CQ news team - by far the largest on Capitol Hill, with more than 100 reporters, editors and researchers - covers virtually every act of Congress, delivering nonpartisan news and analysis unavailable anywhere else. Each issue of CQ Weekly - in your stacks or fully archived to 1983 on the Web - looks forward and back. Readers get in-depth reports on issues looming on the congressional horizon, plus a complete wrap up the previous week's news, including the status of bills in play, behind-the-scenes maneuvering, committee and floor activity, debates and all roll-call votes. Search by topic, page number, committee, 'exact phrases or words', bill number, byline or reporter and by Boolean full-text and date searches. Detailed floor votes dating back to August 1983 are easily retrieved.

children.name: Digital National Security Archive
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: The Digital National Security Archive contains the most comprehensive set of declassified government documents available. The resource now includes 44 collections consisting of over 104,000 meticulously indexed documents, with more than 733,000 total pages. Each of these collections, compiled by top scholars and experts, exhaustively covers the most critical world events, countries, and U.S. policy decisions from post World War II through the 21st century.

children.name: Early Republic : Critical Editions on the Founding of the United States
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc:
Includes 20 volumes of primary material documenting the actions, debates, and thoughts of the First Federal Congress and its members.
The Early Republic contains 20,000 annotated pages and 260 images, a cumulative index and robust search engine.

children.name: Europa World
children.subject: Economics|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Europa World is the online version of the Europa World Year Book, the indispensable source of information on world-wide affairs. First published in 1926, the year book is renowned as one of the world's leading reference works, covering political and economic information in over 250 countries and territories, from Afghanistan to Zimbabwe. Statistical data by country and directory contact details of nearly 2000 international organizations.

children.name: Federal Response to Radicalism in the 1960s
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Criminal Justice
children.desc: From the Federal Bureau of Investigation Library, this product illuminates the enduring conflict in American history between the need of society to protect basic freedoms and the equally legitimate need to protect itself from genuine threats to its security and existence. Organized alphabetically by organization, this collection covers a wide range of viewpoints on political, social, cultural, and economic issues. It sheds light on internal organization, personnel, and activities of some of the most prominent American radical groups and their movements to change American government and society. This collection supports a wide variety of courses in U.S. history, cultural studies, radical politics, and social movements. It covers 1956 to 1971 and contains 87,391 images from files on such individuals as Chavez, Malcolm X and Hoffman and groups such as the Black Panther Party and Students for a Democratic Society and the Weatherman Underground Organization.

children.name: Feminism in Cuba: Nineteenth through Twentieth Century Archival Documents
children.subject: American Studies|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: This collection, compiled from Cuban sources, spans the period from Cuban independence to the end of the Batista regime. The collection sheds light on Cuban feminism, women in politics, literature by Cuban women and the legal status of Cuban women. This collection of unique and difficult to acquire materials, lends itself to a study of Cuban women in politics, Cuban feminism, Cuban women’s literature and the legal status of women from 1898 through 1958. The documents in this collection, most of which are in Spanish, fall into three categories: works by feminists about feminists and their causes, works by men on the status of women, and literary works by feminist writers that illustrate or discuss the condition of women.

children.name: History Vault (See ProQuest History Vault)
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: History Vault provides access to millions of primary source, cross-searchable, full-text/full-image documents on the most widely studied topics in 19th and 20th-century American history. The vast majority of the content in History Vault is not available elsewhere. The content in History Vault is perfect for researchers in history, African American studies, women’s studies, political science, social sciences, sociology, and international studies.

children.name: Homeland Security Digital Library
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies|Law and Public Policy
children.desc: Resources in the Homeland Security Digital Library cover a wide range of homeland security topics and are carefully selected and evaluated by a team of librarians and content specialists. Sources include, but are not limited to: Federal, state and local governments; International governments and institutions; Nonprofit organizations and private sector entities; Think tanks, research centers, colleges and universities, and more. The Public Collection includes over 81,000 public domain items. Some highlighted sections: U.S. Policy and Strategy Documents related to homeland security; General U.S. Policy Documents, National Strategies, Executive Orders, Presidential Directives, and Key Legislation; Congressional Hearings and Legislation; CRS Reports & Issue Briefs; and GAO Reports & Testimony

children.name: International Women's Periodicals, 1786-1933: Social and Political Issues
children.subject: History|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Historical women’s periodicals provide an important resource to scholars interested in the lives of women, the role of women in society and, in particular, the development of the public lives of women as the push for women’s rights grew in the United States and England. A variety of viewpoints are presented for study. Includes 103,870 images from 1786 to 1933.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: National Citizen and Ballot Box
children.subject: American Studies|History|Political Science|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A monthly journal deeply involved in the roots of the American feminist movement. Owned and edited by Matilda Joslyn Gage, American women’s rights advocate, who helped to lead and publicize the suffrage movement in the United States. Includes essays on a wide range of issues and regular columns about prominent women in history and female inventors. 1876-1881

children.name: New York Review of Books
children.subject: English & American Literature|Political Science
children.desc: Includes reviews, in-depth articles on politics, books, and culture. Access complete archive from 1963 to present.

children.name: New York State Newspapers
children.subject: History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: 20 major newspapers published in the state of New York, including the New York Times and the New York Post. Dates of coverage generally range from year 2000 or later with a couple of exceptions. Nothing earlier than 1965 (NYT).

children.name: Opposing Viewpoints in Context
children.subject: History|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc:
Covering today’s hottest social issues, this cross-curricular research tool supports science, social studies, current events, and language arts classes. Its informed, differing views present each side of an issue . Features continuously updated viewpoint articles, topic overviews, etc. Scope and Depth:
More than 19,600 pro/con viewpoints
More than 13,000 topic overviews
More than 12,600 charts and graphs, along with other statistical information
300+ profiles of federal agencies and special-interest groups
Special coverage of the annual debate topic determined by the National Speech and Debate Association
Full-text newspapers and periodicals from multiple perspectives, including National Review, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Commentary, and CNN Wire

children.name: OxResearch
children.subject: Economics|Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Provides analytical articles covering world and regional economic and political developments of major significance. It evaluates issues and events within a coherent political, social and economic framework. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: Papers of Dwight David Eisenhower (The)
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: Contains the entire 21-volumes of The Papers of Dwight D. Eisenhower including significant letters, memoranda, cables, and directives written or dictated by Eisenhower from the years prior to World War II through the full term of his presidency. This collection includes documents, many of them previously classified from private collections and public archives in the U.S. and U.K., as well as papers from the Eisenhower Presidential Library.

children.name: Political Science Complete
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science
children.desc: Provides full text for more than 520 journals, and indexing and abstracts for over 2,900  titles, (including top-ranked scholarly journals), many of which are unique to the product. The database also features full-text reference books, monographs, and full-text conference papers, including those of the International Political Science Association. Includes a subject-specific thesaurus.

children.name: Project Muse
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|Government & Politics|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Humanities|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: Full-text of scholarly, peer-reviewed journals focusing on the fields of literature and criticism, history, the visual and performing arts, cultural studies, education, political science, gender studies, and many others. Browse by title or research area. 1995 to present.

children.name: ProQuest Congressional
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: Covers abstracts and indexing for Hearings, Reports, Documents and Committee prints. The subscription also covers bill tracking & profiles, bill text, members and committee coverage, the Daily Congressional Record and the Code of Federal Regulations and Federal Register, and political news.

children.name: ProQuest Criminal Justice
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice
children.desc: Coverage of U.S. and international criminal justice journals, supporting research on crime, its causes and impacts, legal and social implications, as well as litigation and crime trends. Also includes correctional and law enforcement trade publications, crime reports, crime blogs and other material.

children.name: ProQuest History Vault
children.subject: American Studies|History|Political Science|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Created from primary source materials from the University Publications of America (UPA) Collections. Includes Civil Rights Movement & the Black Freedom Struggle Modules, Women Studies,World War II documents, and more. Select History Vault from a list of Providers to see the complete holdings.

children.name: ProQuest Military Collection
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Covers topics across all government and military branches, including international relations, political science, criminology, defense, aeronautics and space flight, communications, civil engineering, and more. It includes 550+ titles, with more than 400 available in full-text, dating back to the early 1990's. Deep backfile is available for a few select titles: Marine Corps Gazette dating back to 1916, Leatherneck dating back to 1921, and Foreign Affairs dating back to 1923.

children.name: ProQuest Political Science
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Access to hundreds of leading political science and international relations journals, providing full-text of many core titles indexed in Worldwide Political Science Abstracts. In addition, over a thousand recent full-text doctoral dissertations on political science topics are included, together with working papers, conference proceedings, country profiles, political news and other sources. Including such topics as comparative politics, political economy, international development, environmental policy, and hundreds of related topics. Coverage: 1985 - current

children.name: ProQuest Research Library
children.subject: Political Science|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Provides one-stop access to a wide range of popular academic subjects, from 1971 forward. It features a diversified mix of scholarly journals, trade publications, magazines, and newspapers. ProQuest Research Library is designed to cover the top 150 core academic subject reference areas.

children.name: ProQuest Social Science Journals
children.subject: Economics|Anthropology|Education|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice
children.desc: It covers core disciplines across the social sciences including sociology, social work, anthropology, politics and other areas, featuring journals from over 50 countries, facilitating multidisciplinary research and providing researchers with a variety of perspectives.

children.name: Revolution (The)
children.subject: History|Political Science|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: The Revolution, a weekly women’s rights newspaper, was the official publication of the National Woman Suffrage Association formed by feminists Elizabeth Cady Stanton and Susan B. Anthony to secure women’s enfranchisement through a federal constitutional amendment. Published between 1868 and 1872, it was edited by Stanton and Parker Pillsbury. As the official voice of the National Woman Suffrage Association, the paper confronted subjects not discussed in most mainstream publications of the time including sex education, rape, domestic violence, divorce, prostitution and reproductive rights. It was instrumental in attracting working-class women to the movement by devoting columns to concerns such as unionization and discrimination against female workers.

children.name: Social Explorer
children.subject: Business|Economics|American Studies|Education|History|Political Science|Social Sciences|Religious Studies
children.desc: An online research tool designed to provide quick and easy access to current and historical census data and demographic information. Interactive custom maps, downloadable reports, and more.

children.name: Social Sciences Full Text
children.subject: American Studies|Asian Studies|Education|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|International Studies|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Subject coverage includes addiction studies, anthropology, community health & medical care, communications, economics, environmental studies, ethics, family studies, gender studies, geography, international relations, law, mass media, minority studies, political science, psychiatry, psychology, public welfare, social work, urban studies and much more.

children.name: State Papers Online (1509-1714)
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: Two hundred years of British and European history, from the reign of Henry VIII to the end of the reign of Queen Anne. State Papers Online gathers together 16th- and 17th- century British State Papers and links these rare historical manuscripts to their fully text-searchable Calendars.

children.name: Struggle for Women's Rights: Organizational Records, 1880-1990
children.subject: History|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: The Women's Studies modules in History Vault consist of records of suffrage organizations and other women's rights organizations as well as personal papers of women's rights advocates, many of whom were involved in the suffrage movement. Includes records of the National Woman's Party, League of Women Voters, and the Women's Action Alliance; and manuscript collections from the Schlesinger Library at Radcliffe College. These collections focus on voting rights, national politics, and reproductive rights.

children.name: U.S. Congressional Serial Set Maps, 1817-1994
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: Map images, records, and indexing for maps published in Reports and Documents of the 15th Congress, 1st Session through the 103rd Congress, 2nd session. Covering years of publication: 1817-1994, Serial Set Volumes: 1 - 14277.

children.name: U.S. Congressional Serial Set, 1817-1994
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: 15th Congress - 103rd Congress, 2nd session; The bound, sequentially numbered volumes of all the Reports, Documents, and Journals of the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives constitute a rich collection of primary source material on all aspects of American history.

children.name: Vietnam Veterans Against the War (VVAW)
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: Part of the Archives Unbound Digital Collection, America in Protest: Records of Anti-Vietnam War Organizations, The Vietnam Veterans Against the War started in 1967 with six Vietnam veterans marching for peace in New York City. The purpose of the organization was to give voice to the returning servicemen who opposed the on-going war in Southeast Asia. This publication consists of FBI reports dealing with every aspect of antiwar work carried out by the VVAW. The collection also includes surveillance on a variety of other antiwar groups and individuals, with an emphasis on student groups and Communist organizations.  The materials in this publication have been released under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Under FOIA regulations, the FBI and other federal agencies reserve the right to withhold or delete any documents or segments of documents due to privacy concerns, confidentiality of sources, and/or matters of national security.

children.name: Virginia Gazette
children.subject: History|Political Science|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: The Virginia Gazette was the first newspaper published in Virginia and the first to be published in the area south of the Potomac River in the colonial period of the United States. Issues have the following subtitle: Containing the freshest advices, foreign and domestick. Published weekly in Williamsburg, Virginia between 1736 and 1780, The Virginia Gazette contained news covering all of Virginia and also included information from other colonies, Scotland, England and additional countries.  As Williamsburg was the center of growing tensions in the Virginia Colony which led to the American Revolution, the newspaper was one of the centers of activity in the capital of Virginia, and dutifully published accounts. When at the urging of Gov. Thomas Jefferson the capital was relocated to Richmond in 1780, the newspaper followed. The final issue of The Virginia Gazette produced in Williamsburg was April 8, 1780.

children.name: Washington Post: Historical Newspapers (1877 - 1999)
children.subject: History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides users with easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

children.name: Women and Social Movements in the United States
children.subject: American Studies|History|Political Science|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Organized around the history of women in social movements in the U.S. between 1600 and 2000. The collection currently includes 116 document projects and archives with 4,700 documents and more than 160,000 pages of additional full-text documents, written by more than 2,450 primary authors. It also includes book, film, and website reviews, notes from the archives, and teaching tools.

children.name: Women in Politics Bibliographic Database
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|International Studies|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: This database contains bibliographic references on books and articles dealing with women in politics. Courtesy of the Inter-Parliamentary Union, it has been developed with the contribution of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

children.name: Women's Studies Manuscript Collections
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: This module consists of three distinct series of collections from the Schlesinger Library: voting rights, national politics, and reproductive rights. The series tell the story of the movement at the national, regional, and local levels. The papers of key national leaders like Julia Ward Howe, Anna Howard Shaw, and Matilda Gage are included. Equally important are the papers of lesser known state and local leaders like Catharine Waugh McCulloch of Illinois, Olympia Brown of Wisconsin, and Nellie Nugent Somerville of Mississippi. In addition, this module also includes records on women involved in national politics, like Mary Dewson and Jeannette B. Rankin. Finally, the last piece is records from the Schlesinger Library’s family planning oral history project and records of Mary Ware Dennett and the Voluntary Parenthood League.

children.name: World War II Digital Archive
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: World War II: U.S. Documents on Planning, Operations, Intelligence, Axis War Crimes, and Refugees. Includes records of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Records of the War Department Operations Division, U.S. Navy Action and Operational Reports, President Franklin D. Roosevelt's Map Room Files, Records of the Office of War Information, Papers of the War Refugee Board, and several other collections documenting U.S. planning and participation in World War II.

children.name: Annual Reviews
children.subject: Physics|Psychology|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: Annual Reviews articles: (1) Capture current understanding of a topic, including what is well supported and what is controversial. (2) Set the work in historical context. (3) Highlight the major questions that remain to be addressed and the likely course of research in upcoming years. (4) Outline the practical applications and general significance of research to society.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: Neurology Collection
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology|Neuroscience
children.desc: Updated regularly, this comprehensive online neurology resource covers the entire spectrum of neurology from the basics to specialty-specific content – optimized for viewing on any device. Includes texts, multimedia, and more.

children.name: Nursing and Allied Health
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology
children.desc: This database offers reliable, comprehensive coverage of the fields of nursing and allied health including journals, video, dissertations, reference books and more.

children.name: ProQuest Health and Medical Complete
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: Combines the clinical research titles available in ProQuest Medical Library with hundreds of additional consumer and health administration titles.

children.name: ProQuest Psychology
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: Abstracts and indexing for more than 650 titles, with over 540 titles available in full text. Users get access to charts, diagrams, graphs, tables, photos, and other graphical elements essential to psychological research. Additionally, the database includes 4,000 full text dissertations representing a range of psychology disciplines. Many titles are indexed in PsycINFO.

children.name: ProQuest Social Science Journals
children.subject: Economics|Anthropology|Education|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice
children.desc: It covers core disciplines across the social sciences including sociology, social work, anthropology, politics and other areas, featuring journals from over 50 countries, facilitating multidisciplinary research and providing researchers with a variety of perspectives.

children.name: PsycARTICLES
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Full-text, peer-reviewed scholarly and scientific articles in psychology. It contains articles from journals published by the American Psychological Association (APA), and others. Coverage spans 1894 to present; Indexed with controlled vocabulary from APA's Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms.

children.name: PsycCRITIQUES
children.subject: Psychology|Social Sciences
children.desc: A database of full-text book reviews featuring current scholarly and professional books in psychology. It also publishes reviews from a psychological perspective of popular films and trade books. Includes reviews back to 1956 and is indexed with controlled vocabulary from APA's Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms.

children.name: PsycINFO
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Contains over 3 million citations and summaries of journal articles, book chapters, books, dissertations and technical reports. Ninety-nine percent of its content is peer-reviewed. Journal coverage spans from the 1800s to the present. PsycINFO is indexed with controlled vocabulary from APA's Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms.

children.name: PubMed Central
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: PubMed Central is a free archive of biomedical and life sciences journal literature at the U.S. National Institutes of Health's National Library of Medicine (NIH/NLM). In addition to its role as an archive, the value of PMC lies in its capacity to store and cross-reference data from diverse sources using a common format within a single repository.

children.name: PubMed
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: PubMed comprises citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. Citations and abstracts include the fields of biomedicine and health, covering portions of the life sciences, behavioral sciences, chemical sciences, and bioengineering. PubMed also provides access to additional relevant web sites and links to the other NCBI molecular biology resources.

children.name: Social Sciences Full Text
children.subject: American Studies|Asian Studies|Education|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|International Studies|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Subject coverage includes addiction studies, anthropology, community health & medical care, communications, economics, environmental studies, ethics, family studies, gender studies, geography, international relations, law, mass media, minority studies, political science, psychiatry, psychology, public welfare, social work, urban studies and much more.

children.name: Arts & Humanities Citation Index
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Part of the Web of Science database, a multidisciplinary database covering the journal literature of the arts and humanities, with cited references but not abstracts. Indexes 1,300+ of the world's leading arts and humanities journals, plus individually selected, relevant items from over 7,000 major science and social science journals. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: ATLA Religion Database with ATLASerials
children.subject: Classics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: ATLA Religion Database® (ATLA RDB®) with ATLASerials® (ATLAS®) combines the premier index to journal articles, book reviews, and collections of essays in all fields of religion with ATLA's online collection of major religion and theology journals. The ATLA Religion Database includes more than 620,000 article citations from more than 1,746 journals (575 currently indexed), more than 250,000 essay citations from over 18,000 multi-author works, more than 570,000 book review citations, and a growing number of multimedia citations. Coverage in this database begins in 1949 although indexing for some journal titles extends back into the nineteenth century. In ATLASerials, full text is provided for more than 380,000 electronic articles and book reviews from more than 220 journals selected by leading religion scholars in the United States. This database is produced by the American Theological Library Association.

children.name: Chinese Recorder, and the Protestant Missionary Community in China,1867-1941 (The)
children.subject: Asian Studies|History|Religious Studies
children.desc: Published in English in China, the Chinese Recorder (1867-1941) covered such diverse topics as the beginnings of mission schools; the Boxer Rebellion; the crusade against opium; the ecumenical missionary conferences of 1877, 1890, and 1907; the 1911 Revolution; the growth of the Chinese church; and the rise of communism in China. Although it was intended primarily for the missionaries in China, the Chinese Recorder also circulated to mission supporters and theological schools in the home countries. This database contains 52,083 images.

children.name: Encyclopedia of Women & Islamic Cultures
children.subject: Religious Studies
children.desc: The Encyclopedia of Women and Islamic Cultures Online is an interdisciplinary, trans-historical, and global project embracing women and Islamic cultures in every region where there have been significant Muslim populations. It aims to cover every topic for which there is significant research, examining these regions from the period just before the rise of Islam to the present. The Encyclopedia of Women and Islamic Cultures Online crosses history, geographic borders and disciplines to create a groundbreaking reference work reflecting the very latest research on gender studies and the Islamic world. Coverage includes religion, history, politics, anthropology, geography and related disciplines.

children.name: Humanities Full Text
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Humanities Full Text includes many of the most important academic journals in the humanities with the full text of articles from over 300 periodicals dating back to 1995, and high-quality indexing for almost 700 journals—of which 470 are peer-reviewed—dating as far back as 1984. The database provides coverage of feature articles, interviews, bibliographies, obituaries, and original works of fiction, drama, poetry and book reviews, as well as reviews of ballets, dance programs, motion pictures, musicals, radio and television programs, plays, operas, and more. Topics covered include classical studies, literary & social criticism, philosophy, religion & theology, literature, art, dance, film, folklore, music, performing arts, area studies, communications, gender studies, history, journalism, linguistics, archaeology, and much more.

children.name: Index to Jewish Periodicals
children.subject: Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Provides a comprehensive guide to English-language articles, book reviews, and feature stories in more than 230 journals devoted to Jewish affairs. Most references are not found in standard periodical literature guides. Index to Jewish Periodicals is intended for students of Jewish thought and others interested in contemporary Jewish and Middle Eastern affairs. Journal coverage dates back as far as 1988.

children.name: Jerusalem Post: Historical Newspapers (1932 - 2008)
children.subject: History|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides genealogists, researchers and scholars with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time, 1932 - 2008.

children.name: Opposing Viewpoints in Context
children.subject: History|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc:
Covering today’s hottest social issues, this cross-curricular research tool supports science, social studies, current events, and language arts classes. Its informed, differing views present each side of an issue . Features continuously updated viewpoint articles, topic overviews, etc. Scope and Depth:
More than 19,600 pro/con viewpoints
More than 13,000 topic overviews
More than 12,600 charts and graphs, along with other statistical information
300+ profiles of federal agencies and special-interest groups
Special coverage of the annual debate topic determined by the National Speech and Debate Association
Full-text newspapers and periodicals from multiple perspectives, including National Review, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Commentary, and CNN Wire

children.name: Philosopher's Index
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: A current and comprehensive bibliographic database covering scholarly research in all major fields of philosophy. Contains research published since 1940 including over 680 journals from more than 50 countries with content representing a variety of languages.

children.name: PhilPapers
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: A comprehensive index and bibliography of philosophy research content maintained by the community of philosophers, including journals, books, open access archives, and personal pages maintained by academics. Also hosts the largest open access archive in philosophy. Classification is maintained by a combination of automatic, crowd-sourcing, and curation work done by appointed academics.

children.name: Project Muse: Religion
children.subject: Religious Studies
children.desc: This link opens Project Muse scoped to the content in the discipline of Religion

children.name: ProQuest Religion
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Primarily full-text, international periodicals for diverse religious and spiritual studies, covering formal theological studies of major religions, as well as the most recent trends and scholarly thought. More full-text journals have been added in related religious studies, such as philosophy, ethics, and international perspectives. Many essential full-text titles cannot be found in any other online database. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: RAMBI: The Index of Articles on Jewish Studies
children.subject: History|Humanities|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: A selective bibliography of academic articles covering all of the fields of Jewish studies. The articles listed are collected from thousands of journals, in print or electronic, from collections of articles and from offprints sent by researchers. RAMBI refers to articles in Hebrew, Latin or Cyrillic letters. The database is updated on a daily basis. Available in Hebrew or English.

children.name: Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: Provides access to over 2,700 articles. Regularly updated with new and revised articles for further discovery and research, clearly organised and with over 25,000 cross-references linking themes, concepts and philosophers. An ideal reference source for subjects related to philosophy, such as politics, psychology, economics, anthropology, religion and literature.

children.name: Social Explorer
children.subject: Business|Economics|American Studies|Education|History|Political Science|Social Sciences|Religious Studies
children.desc: An online research tool designed to provide quick and easy access to current and historical census data and demographic information. Interactive custom maps, downloadable reports, and more.

children.name: the ARDA: Association of Religion Data Archives
children.subject: Social Sciences|Religious Studies|Area Studies|Statistics
children.desc: Founded in 1998, the initial archive was targeted at researchers interested in American religion. The targeted audience and the data collection have both greatly expanded, now including American and international collections and developing features for educators, journalists, religious congregations, and researchers.

children.name: ABSEES Online
children.subject: Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Education
children.desc: Provides information on East-Central Europe and the former Soviet Union. Sources indexed include journals, books, dissertations, online resources and selected government publications published in the U.S. and Canada. Coverage from 1989-present.

children.name: Alexander III and the Policy of 'Russification', 1883-1886
children.subject: Slavic and East European Studies|History
children.desc:
Date Range: 1883-1886
This collection provides an analysis of a 'retro-reform' policy, including the increase of revolutionary agitation, deepening of conservatism and changes from agrarian to industrial society, and spread of pan-Slavism, both in the Russian Empire and Eastern Europe.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: Social Sciences Citation Index
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Education|History|Sociology|Social Sciences|Ethics
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the social sciences from 1997 to the present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: ABI/INFORM Complete
children.subject: Business|Economics|Social Sciences
children.desc: Includes global, trade and industry, and dateline components with full‐text journals and titles from the business press, key trade publications, working papers, dissertations, conference proceedings, and market reports. Also includes ABI/INFORM Archive, which offers a deep backfile.

children.name: Accessible Archives
children.subject: History|Humanities|Social Sciences|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: Diverse primary source materials reflecting broad views across American history and culture have been assembled into comprehensive databases. Includes African American Newspapers, American County Histories, Civil War Newspapers, Godey’s Lady’s Book, The Pennsylvania Gazette, History of Woman Suffrage, Frank Leslie’s Weekly, The Liberator, Twelve Years a Slave, and more.

children.name: America in Protest: Records of Anti-Vietnam War Organizations, The Vietnam Veterans Against the War
children.subject: American Studies|Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc:
Date Range: 1967-1975
This publication consists of FBI reports dealing with every aspect of antiwar work carried out by the Vietnam Veterans Against the War (VVAW) which started in 1967 with six Vietnam veterans marching for peace in New York City. The purpose of the organization was to give voice to the returning servicemen who opposed the on-going war in Southeast Asia. The ranks of the membership eventually grew to over 30,000. The collection also includes surveillance on a variety of other antiwar groups and individuals, with an emphasis on student groups and Communist organizations.

children.name: Archives Unbound
