children.desc: This link opens Project Muse scoped to the content in the discipline of Women's Studies, Gender, & Sexuality

children.name: World Shakespeare Bibliography Online
children.subject: English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: The World Shakespeare Bibliography Online is a searchable electronic database consisting of the most comprehensive record of Shakespeare-related scholarship and theatrical productions published or produced worldwide between 1960 and 2016. It provides annotated entries for all important books, articles, book reviews,dissertations, theatrical productions, reviews of productions, audiovisual materials, electronic media, and other scholarly and popular materials related to Shakespeare.

children.name: JSTOR
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Africana Studies|American Studies|Asian Studies|Biology|Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Education|Environmental Science|Government & Politics|Health & Medicine|History|Music|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Political Science|Sociology|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Jewish Studies|Criminal Justice|Area Studies|Literature|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A digital library of back issues of academic journals, books, and primary sources. Core titles from each discipline included. Moving wall, typically does not include the most current 3-5 years.

children.name: Handbook of Latin American Studies (HLAS) Online
children.subject: History|International Studies|Area Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc: The Handbook is a bibliography on Latin America consisting of works selected and annotated by scholars. Edited by the Hispanic Division of the Library of Congress, the multidisciplinary Handbook alternates annually between the social sciences and the humanities.

children.name: MarciveWeb DOCS
children.subject: Government & Politics
children.desc: Searchable catalog of U.S. Government Publications from July 1976 through the present. Links to Schaffer Library and other local depository library holdings are provided. Web links are included for documents with an online counterpart.

children.name: Neurology Collection
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology|Neuroscience
children.desc: Updated regularly, this comprehensive online neurology resource covers the entire spectrum of neurology from the basics to specialty-specific content – optimized for viewing on any device. Includes texts, multimedia, and more.

children.name: Mergent Online
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: A fully searchable database with financials details of over 25,000 active and inactive U.S. companies; access to companies representing over 95% of the non-U.S. global market capitalization; Annual reports from globally listed companies, with archived reports for over 15 years; Information on all direct and indirect subsidiaries of a company; and daily updates on confirmed executives from all U.S. traded companies, featuring profiles on current and former executives, including executive biographies and compensation information.

children.name: PubMed Central
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: PubMed Central is a free archive of biomedical and life sciences journal literature at the U.S. National Institutes of Health's National Library of Medicine (NIH/NLM). In addition to its role as an archive, the value of PMC lies in its capacity to store and cross-reference data from diverse sources using a common format within a single repository.

children.name: PubMed
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: PubMed comprises citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. Citations and abstracts include the fields of biomedicine and health, covering portions of the life sciences, behavioral sciences, chemical sciences, and bioengineering. PubMed also provides access to additional relevant web sites and links to the other NCBI molecular biology resources.

children.name: Naxos Music Library
children.subject: Music|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Naxos Music Library [NML] is the world´s largest online classical music library. New CDs are added to the library every month. The library offers the complete Naxos and Marco Polo catalogues plus the complete catalogues or selected titles from over 650 record label. Contents searched by composer, work, genre and label; by keyword and advanced search. NML provides liner notes for many recordings. Listeners can create personalized playlists or use predefined Naxos Music Library playlists.

children.name: Naxos Spoken Word Library
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Humanities
children.desc: Includes literature and poetry from medieval times to the twentieth century, and many newly written texts supplement an ever-expanding range of non-fiction.

children.name: NCBI - National Center for Biotechnology Information
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology
children.desc: Comprehensive bioinformatics site. In addition to GenBank, NCBI supports and distributes a variety of databases for the medical and scientific communities: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM), the Molecular Modeling Database (MMDB) of 3D protein structures, the Unique Human Gene Sequence Collection (UniGene), a Gene Map of the Human Genome, the Taxonomy Browser, and the Cancer Genome Anatomy Project (CGAP), in collaboration with the National Cancer Institute.

children.name: New York Times Digital
children.desc: The Academic Pass provides you with full access to NYTimes.com and the NYTimes.com smartphone apps* for a period of 52 weeks from the date you activate it.

children.name: Newspaper Archive
children.subject: History
children.desc: Contains tens of millions of newspaper pages from 1607 to present. Every newspaper in the archive is fully searchable by keyword and date.

children.name: PressReader
children.subject: Modern Languages
children.desc: Provides online access to today's newspapers from around the world in full-color, full-page format. The ever-expanding collection currently includes over 5000+ newspapers and magazines from 100 countries in 60 languages. Viewers can browse articles and other key content, such as pictures, advertisements, classifieds, and notices. Includes a 60-day backfile and the ability to perform keyword searches within any issue.

children.name: American National Biography
children.subject: American Studies|History
children.desc: American National Biography offers portraits of more than 18,700 men and women -- from all eras and walks of life -- whose lives have shaped the nation. Updated semi-annually, with new entries and revisions of previously published entries to enhance their accuracy and currency. The ANB Online features over 2,700 illustrations, more than 80,000 hyperlinked cross-references, links to select web sites. The format of articles is based on chronology. A given article traces a person's life through the sequence of significant events as they occurred from birth to death.The concluding paragraph of the text is usually meant to put the subject's life in historical perspective, as seen from the vantage point of the late twentieth and early twenty-first centuries. Appended to each article is a descriptive bibliography, which may include mention of primary sources, the most useful published biographies, articles or monographs about specific aspects of the person's career, and obituaries.

children.name: Dictionary of National Biography
children.subject: History
children.desc: The Oxford Dictionary of National Biography is the national record of men and women who have shaped British history and culture, worldwide, from the Romans to the 21st century. With concise, up-to-date biographies written by named, specialist authors. It now includes biographies of 59,558 men and women who died in or before the year 2011—plus 513 ‘Theme’ articles for reference and research.

children.name: Encyclopedia of Popular Music Online
children.desc: The online version of Colin Larkin's 10-volume The Encyclopedia of Popular Music, 4th Edition is now available through Oxford Music Online. Containing 27,000 entries (6,000+ new). Featuring a broad musical scope covering popular music of all genres and periods from 1900 to the present day, including jazz, country, folk, rap, reggae, techno, musicals, and world music, the Encyclopedia also offers thousands of additional entries covering popular music genres, trends, styles, record labels, venues, and music festivals. Key dates, biographies, and further reading are provided for artists covered, along with complete discographies that include record labels, release dates, and a 5-star album rating system.  The Encyclopedia of Popular Music, 4th edition, Colin Larkin, is no longer available for subscription and is available only to current perpetual-access holders. The Encyclopedia of Popular Music was last updated in May 2009, and will not be updated further. Additional articles on popular music may be found in GMO, which is added to and updated regularly.

children.name: Oxford Art Online
children.subject: Digital Arts/Media|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: The authority on art from pre-history to present day. Includes: The Oxford Companion to Western Art; The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms; and the Encyclopedia of Aesthetics. Also articles about topics, bibliographies for further research, and thousands of searchable images made available through Oxford's partnerships with museums, galleries, and other outstanding arts organizations. Through a single, elegant gateway users can access—and simultaneously cross-search—an expanding range of Oxford’s acclaimed art reference works: Grove Art Online, the Benezit Dictionary of Artists, the Encyclopedia of Aesthetics, The Oxford Companion to Western Art, and The Concise Oxford Dictionary of Art Terms, as well as many specially commissioned articles and bibliographies available exclusively online.

children.name: Oxford Classical Dictionary
children.subject: Classics|Humanities
children.desc: Covers all aspects of the classical world from literature and history to religion, science, and archaeology.  As well as providing factual information, the Dictionary contains many thematic entries on subjects relevant to the 21st century such as nationalism, race, gender, and ecology. Anthropology and reception have been added as new subject areas, covering topics such as creolization and kinship, as well as dance reception and translation.

children.name: Oxford English Dictionary
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Offers the best in etymological analysis, listings of variant spellings, and shows pronunciation using the International Phonetic Alphabet, tracing the evolution of more than 600,000 words over the last 1000 years through 3 million quotations from a wide range of sources.

children.name: Oxford Music Online
children.subject: Music|Humanities
children.desc: Oxford Music Online hosts Grove Music Online and other Oxford music reference works. Content includes: Grove Music Online; The Oxford Dictionary of Music; The Oxford Companion to Music; and Encyclopedia of Popular Music Oral History Online, and more.

children.name: Oxford Reference
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Brings together language and subject dictionaries and reference works into a single cross-searchable resource.

children.name: Social Explorer
children.subject: Business|Economics|American Studies|Education|History|Political Science|Social Sciences|Religious Studies
children.desc: An online research tool designed to provide quick and easy access to current and historical census data and demographic information. Interactive custom maps, downloadable reports, and more.

children.name: New Palgrave Dictionary of Economics Online
children.subject: Economics
children.desc: Contains full text of 2008 print edition, incorporates quarterly additions and updates, offers excellent search and browse facilities, contains hyperlinked cross-references within articles, selected and maintained links to related sites, and provides access to full text of the 1987 Archive edition.

children.name: ABI/INFORM Complete
children.subject: Business|Economics|Social Sciences
children.desc: Includes global, trade and industry, and dateline components with full‐text journals and titles from the business press, key trade publications, working papers, dissertations, conference proceedings, and market reports. Also includes ABI/INFORM Archive, which offers a deep backfile.

children.name: Accounting & Tax
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Includes highly ranked global and scholarly journals covering current news and topics, as well as the trends and history influencing important accounting and tax issues of the day. 1971 - current

children.name: Agricultural & Environmental Science Database
children.subject: Environmental Science|Geology|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Combines information on scientific research and government policies in a single resource. Material from conference proceedings and hard-to-find documents has been summarized along with information from primary journals in the field. Coverage from 1981 to the present.

children.name: Alt-Press Watch
children.desc: Providing an alternative to corporate controlled media, this database presents content from 1970 to the present, showcasing unique, independent voices from many respected and cited grassroots newspapers, magazines, and journals. Access regional and metropolitan perspectives on local, national, and international issues in areas such as government, policy, culture, and religion.

children.name: American Film Institute Catalog
children.subject: Film Studies|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: The AFI Catalog covers the history of American cinema comprehensively from 1893 to 1975, with full or short records for films from 1976-2011. New records are added each year.

children.name: Banking Information Source
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: This database enables you to search essential banking industry publications for information about the financial services industry, banking and industry trends from 1971 to the present. In today's banking world, keeping informed of what's happening in economic markets is as important as monitoring national and international developments. Banking Information Source can help users predict future market trends, monitor the rise of future competition, and even pick up ideas that have worked successfully in the financial services market. The database brings together leading journals from the most important international markets and allows you to analyze and compare articles from 360 full-text sources.

children.name: Black Studies Center
children.subject: Africana Studies|History
children.desc: Black Studies Center is a fully cross-searchable gateway to Black Studies including scholarly essays, recent periodicals, historical newspaper articles, reference books, and much more. It combines essential resources for research and teaching in Black Studies, including The Schomburg Studies on the Black Experience, Index to Black Periodicals Full Text, Black Literature Index, and the Chicago Defender historical newspaper from 1912-1975. Add-on modules include The HistoryMakers® oral history video resource with extensive interviews with 100 contemporary African Americans, eight additional historical black newspapers, Black Abolitionist Papers, and Black Studies Dissertations.

children.name: Boston Globe: Historical Newspapers (1872-1983)
children.subject: History
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides genealogists, researchers and scholars with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time from 1872 to 1983.

children.name: Chicago Defender (1910-1975): Historical Newspapers
children.subject: Africana Studies|History
children.desc: The Chicago Defender (1910-1975) offers full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue. The collection includes digital reproductions providing access to every page from every available issue. It provides genealogists, researchers and scholars with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

children.name: Chicago Tribune: Historical Newspapers (1849 - 1992)
children.desc: The Chicago Tribune (1849-1992) offers full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue. The collection includes digital reproductions providing access to every page from every available issue.

children.name: Congressional Universe (Now ProQuest Congressional)
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: The Congressional Basic Subscription covers abstracts and indexing for Hearings, Reports, Documents and Committee prints from 1970-present (there are links to HTML text from approximately the mid-1990s) The Congressional basic subscription also covers bill tracking & profiles, bill text, members and committee coverage, the Daily Congressional Record and the Code of Federal Regulations and Federal Register, and political news.

children.name: Dissertations & Theses Abstracts & Indexes
children.desc: This database is the world’s most comprehensive collection of dissertations and theses from around the world, spanning from 1743 to the present day for a number of subject areas. Abstracts of Dissertations and theses from institutions in North America and Europe. Selectively covers masters theses and dissertations including dissertations from Canada, Great Britain, and Europe. 1861 to present; Abstracts since 1980; Thesis abstracts since 1988. Updated monthly.

children.name: ebrary
children.desc: The ebrary eBook collection is a growing collection of more than 42,000 books and historic and geopolitical maps, every page searchable. Especially strong in key academic subject areas including Business & Economics, Computers, Technology & Engineering, Humanities, Life & Physical Sciences, and Social and Behavioral Sciences. eBooks are available from more than 150 publishers, such as: Brill Academic Publishers, John Wiley & Sons, Johns Hopkins University Press, MIT, Taylor & Francis, Palgrave-MacMillan, and more. Features personalized bookshelves, annotation abilities, and highlighting. Requires download of plug-in viewer from site.

children.name: Entrepreneurship
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Search worldwide publications and multi-media related to the topic of Entrepreneurship. Intended to bridge theory with practice, the Entrepreneurship database covers a wide spectrum of resources useful to educators, researchers, students and practitioners. Content ranges from the scholarly - including journals, dissertations, working papers and conference proceedings - to a full toolkit of practical guides, templates, forms, sample business plans and tips from successful entrepreneur in a wide range of formats - from video to downloadable Word and Excel files, as well as traditional text and PDFs.

children.name: FIAF International Index to Film Periodicals Plus
children.subject: Film Studies|Visual Arts|Humanities
children.desc: The International Federation of Film Archives (FIAF) brings together institutions dedicated to rescuing and preserving films. FIAF's editorial staff, along with its Affiliates, produces the International Index to Film Periodicals which offers in-depth coverage of the world's foremost academic and popular film journals. This database contains FIAF's “Treasures from Film Archives”; a detailed index of the silent-era film holdings of archives from around the world, a selection of Reference volumes and the linked full-text of over 60 journals.

children.name: History Vault (See ProQuest History Vault)
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: History Vault provides access to millions of primary source, cross-searchable, full-text/full-image documents on the most widely studied topics in 19th and 20th-century American history. The vast majority of the content in History Vault is not available elsewhere. The content in History Vault is perfect for researchers in history, African American studies, women’s studies, political science, social sciences, sociology, and international studies.

children.name: Hoover's Company Profiles
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: This database contains proprietary information about more than 40,000 public and non-public companies and 225,000 key executives. Hoover's, widely recognized as a leader in company data, delivers in depth industry analyses, information on a company's location, summary financials, top competitors, top officers and more.

children.name: Jerusalem Post: Historical Newspapers (1932 - 2008)
children.subject: History|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides genealogists, researchers and scholars with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time, 1932 - 2008.

children.name: Literature Online
children.subject: Classics|English & American Literature|Theater & Dance|Modern Languages
children.desc: A leading online resource for the study and teaching of literature in English. It is a fully integrated service that combines the texts of over 355,000 literary works with a vast library of key criticism and reference resources. Includes full-text journals and author biographies.

children.name: Los Angeles Times: Historical Newspapers (1881 - 1991)
children.subject: History
children.desc: Includes historical local, regional and national news. Offers full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue.

children.name: New York Times: Historical Newspapers [1851-2012]
children.subject: American Studies|History
children.desc: Offers full page and article images with searchable full text back to the first issue. The collection includes digital reproductions providing access to every page from every available issue. Updated with content added annually.

children.name: Nursing and Allied Health
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Psychology
children.desc: This database offers reliable, comprehensive coverage of the fields of nursing and allied health including journals, video, dissertations, reference books and more.

children.name: OxResearch
children.subject: Economics|Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies
children.desc: Provides analytical articles covering world and regional economic and political developments of major significance. It evaluates issues and events within a coherent political, social and economic framework. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: Periodicals Archive Online
children.subject: Anthropology|History|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Sociology|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Periodicals Archive Online spans the humanities and social sciences, across 37 key subject areas. It is international in scope with the inclusion of more than 150 foreign-language titles. Coverage is from volume 1 issue 1 of each journal and all issues are digitized from cover to cover. Union has access to Collection 1-3

children.name: Poets on Screen
children.subject: English & American Literature|Humanities
children.desc: Poets On Screen contains video clip recordings of poets reading their own and other poets' work. Browse a list of poems read by contemporary poets; the poems can be viewed alphabetically by author/reader or by poem  title.

children.name: ProQuest Asian Business & Reference
children.subject: Business|Economics|Asian Studies
children.desc:
Offers detailed information on companies, economies, markets, and overall business conditions throughout the Eastern Hemisphere.
News and current awareness sources; country information and statistics; policy and analysis; people and institutions. 1971 - current but full text for certain publications is subject to market availability.

children.name: ProQuest Biology Journals
children.subject: Biochemistry|Biology
children.desc: Access to a wide range of biology topics and includes some of the most popular information resources for users in academic, government, and public research environments. 1998 - current.

children.name: ProQuest Central
children.subject: Social Sciences
children.desc: An aggregated full-text database, provides access to millions of full text articles from thousands of scholarly journals; full text U.S., Canadian and international newspapers; dissertations in the areas of business, psychology, physical sciences, health, education and more; concise business information from thousands of market reports across 43 industries in 40 countries, spanning the UK, Western Europe, Eastern Europe, Asia Pacific, North America, and Latin America.

children.name: ProQuest Computing
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Digital Arts/Media
children.desc: Coverage of computer topics, including database design, software development, web commerce, LANs, WANs, intranets and the internet. The database includes around 450 titles, with over 350 available in full text.

children.name: ProQuest Congressional
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: Covers abstracts and indexing for Hearings, Reports, Documents and Committee prints. The subscription also covers bill tracking & profiles, bill text, members and committee coverage, the Daily Congressional Record and the Code of Federal Regulations and Federal Register, and political news.

children.name: ProQuest Criminal Justice
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|Sociology|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice
children.desc: Coverage of U.S. and international criminal justice journals, supporting research on crime, its causes and impacts, legal and social implications, as well as litigation and crime trends. Also includes correctional and law enforcement trade publications, crime reports, crime blogs and other material.

children.name: ProQuest Education
children.subject: Education|Social Sciences
children.desc: Access to over 900 top educational publications, including more than 600 of the titles in full text. Covers not only the literature on primary, secondary, and higher education but also special education, home schooling, adult education, and hundreds of related topics. Many titles are indexed in the ERIC database.

children.name: ProQuest Entrepreneurship
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Covering a wide spectrum of resources useful to educators, researchers, students and practitioners. Content ranges from the scholarly - including journals, dissertations, working papers and conference proceedings - to a full toolkit of practical guides, templates, forms, sample business plans and tips from successful entrepreneur in a wide range of formats - from video to downloadable Word and Excel files, as well as traditional text and PDFs.

children.name: ProQuest European Business
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Contains the latest European business and financial information. Includes quality resources such as The Economist, Fortune and European Business Journal. Coverage: 1971 - current

children.name: ProQuest Health & Medicine
children.subject: Health & Medicine
children.desc:
1. Canadian Business & Current Affairs Database: Health & Medicine
  2. Career & Technical Education Database: Health & Medicine
  3. Family Health Database
  4. Health Management Database
  5. Health & Medicine
  6. Nursing & Allied Health Database
  7. ProQuest Dissertations & Theses A&I

children.name: ProQuest Health and Medical Complete
children.subject: Biology|Health & Medicine|Philosophy|Psychology|Social Sciences|Ethics|Natural Sciences|Bioethics
children.desc: Combines the clinical research titles available in ProQuest Medical Library with hundreds of additional consumer and health administration titles.

children.name: ProQuest Military Collection
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Covers topics across all government and military branches, including international relations, political science, criminology, defense, aeronautics and space flight, communications, civil engineering, and more. It includes 550+ titles, with more than 400 available in full-text, dating back to the early 1990's. Deep backfile is available for a few select titles: Marine Corps Gazette dating back to 1916, Leatherneck dating back to 1921, and Foreign Affairs dating back to 1923.

children.name: ProQuest Newsstand
children.subject: History|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Offers access to the full text of over 1300 newspapers, news websites and blogs from leading publishers throughout the world. The database includes backfile for most newspapers, providing access to articles, columns, editorials, obituaries and features published in each paper. Major newspapers include the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Chicago Tribune, Washington Post, USA Today, Los Angeles Times, Boston Globe, The Guardian and more. Current local, regional and national news.

children.name: ProQuest Political Science
children.subject: Government & Politics|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Access to hundreds of leading political science and international relations journals, providing full-text of many core titles indexed in Worldwide Political Science Abstracts. In addition, over a thousand recent full-text doctoral dissertations on political science topics are included, together with working papers, conference proceedings, country profiles, political news and other sources. Including such topics as comparative politics, political economy, international development, environmental policy, and hundreds of related topics. Coverage: 1985 - current

children.name: ProQuest Psychology
children.subject: Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Neuroscience
children.desc: Abstracts and indexing for more than 650 titles, with over 540 titles available in full text. Users get access to charts, diagrams, graphs, tables, photos, and other graphical elements essential to psychological research. Additionally, the database includes 4,000 full text dissertations representing a range of psychology disciplines. Many titles are indexed in PsycINFO.

children.name: ProQuest Religion
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Primarily full-text, international periodicals for diverse religious and spiritual studies, covering formal theological studies of major religions, as well as the most recent trends and scholarly thought. More full-text journals have been added in related religious studies, such as philosophy, ethics, and international perspectives. Many essential full-text titles cannot be found in any other online database. Coverage: 1986 - current

children.name: ProQuest Research Library
children.subject: Political Science|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Provides one-stop access to a wide range of popular academic subjects, from 1971 forward. It features a diversified mix of scholarly journals, trade publications, magazines, and newspapers. ProQuest Research Library is designed to cover the top 150 core academic subject reference areas.

children.name: ProQuest Research Library: History
children.subject: History|Humanities|Social Sciences
children.desc: Subject cover includes Civilizations, Historical studies, Military history, Periods & events, US history, and World history.

children.name: ProQuest Research Library: Literature & Language
children.subject: English & American Literature|Modern Languages|Humanities
children.desc: A sub-set of ProQuest Central, subject content includes World Literatures and Linguistics

children.name: ProQuest Science and Technology
children.subject: Engineering|Biology|Environmental Science|Geology|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Includes access to ProQuest Science and Technology databases. BioOne Abstracts, Pollution Abstracts, Biology Journals, Applied and General Science journals, and more.

children.name: ProQuest Social Science Journals
children.subject: Economics|Anthropology|Education|Political Science|Sociology|Psychology|Social Sciences|Criminal Justice
children.desc: It covers core disciplines across the social sciences including sociology, social work, anthropology, politics and other areas, featuring journals from over 50 countries, facilitating multidisciplinary research and providing researchers with a variety of perspectives.

children.name: ProQuest Sociology
children.subject: Anthropology|Sociology|Social Sciences|Ethics
children.desc: Covers the international literature of sociology and social work, including culture and social structure, history and theory of sociology, social psychology, substance abuse and addiction and more. This collection provides full-text coverage of many core titles included in Sociological Abstracts and Social Services Abstracts. As well as hundreds of full text scholarly journals, the database also includes recent full-text doctoral dissertations on sociology.

children.name: ProQuest
children.desc: Searches across all subscribed ProQuest databases. Start dates will vary depending on database.

children.name: Statistical Abstract of the United States (ProQuest)
children.subject: Business|Economics|Government & Politics|History|Social Sciences
children.desc: A comprehensive summary of statistics on the social, political, and economic organization of the United States; with individually indexed tables (and attached spreadsheets), both searchable and browsable. A convenient volume for statistical reference, and as a guide to sources of more information both in print and on the Web.

children.name: Statistical Insight
children.subject: Business|Economics|Education|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: ProQuest Statistical Insight provides abstracting, indexing, and full text for publications from hundreds of public domain and licensed sources, including federal statistical publications; state government and business statistical reports; international statistical publications from the UN, OECD, EU, and more

children.name: Times of India: Historical Newspapers (1838 - 2005)
children.subject: Asian Studies|History|International Studies
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides users with online, easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

children.name: Ulrichsweb
children.desc: Ulrichsweb is an easy to search source of detailed information on periodicals of all types: academic and scholarly journals, e-journals, peer-reviewed titles, popular magazines, newspapers, newsletters, and more. Ulrich's records provide data points such as ISSN, publisher, language, subject, abstracting & indexing coverage, full-text database coverage, tables of contents, and reviews written by librarians.

children.name: Vogue Archive
children.subject: History|Visual Arts|Sociology|Gender, Sexuality and Women's Studies
children.desc: A complete searchable archive of American Vogue, from the first issue in 1892 to the current month, reproduced in high-resolution color page images. Every page, advertisement, cover and fold-out has been included, with rich indexing enabling you to find images by garment type, designer and brand names.  The Vogue Archive contains the entire run of Vogue magazine (US edition), from the first issue in 1892 to the current month. In addition to the editorial content, all covers, advertisements and pictorial features have been captured as separate documents to allow for searching and discovery. For advertisements, the featured company and brand names have been assigned to the document records, and all image captions are captured to a high accuracy, allowing accurate retrieval of photographs and illustrations. Contributor names that appear in image credits, such as photographers, stylists and illustrators, are also indexed. You can also limit your search by journal editor, to find items published during the editorship of, say, Diana Vreeland (1963-71) or Anna Wintour (1988-present).

children.name: Wall Street Journal
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: The financial newspaper of record offering in-depth coverage of national and international finance as well as first rate coverage of hard news. Full text from 1984 to present.

children.name: Wall Street Journal, Eastern edition
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: The financial newspaper of record offering in-depth coverage of national and international finance as well as first rate coverage of hard news. Full text coverage 1984-present.

children.name: Wall Street Journal: Historical Newspapers (1889 - 1998)
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides users with easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

children.name: Washington Post: Historical Newspapers (1877 - 1999)
children.subject: History|Political Science|Social Sciences
children.desc: This historical newspaper provides users with easily-searchable first-hand accounts and unparalleled coverage of the politics, society and events of the time.

children.name: American State Papers, 1789-1838
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc:
Consists of legislative and executive documents, many originating from the important period between 1789 and the beginning of the U.S. Congressional Serial Set in 1817.
Approximately two-thirds of the publications cover the first 14 Congresses (1789-1817), whereas the remaining third chronologically overlap with the Serial Set from 1817-1838.

children.name: Caribbean Newspapers 1718-1876
children.subject: Africana Studies|History|International Studies|Area Studies|Latin American and Caribbean
children.desc:
The largest collection of fully searchable 18th- and 19th-century Caribbean newspapers.
The evolution of the region across two centuries chronicled within more than 140 titles from 22 islands between 1718-1876.
Essential for research on colonial history, the Atlantic slave trade, international commerce, New World slavery and related topics.

children.name: Early American Newspapers - Series I - VII (1690-1922)
children.subject: American Studies|History
children.desc: Search or browse early American newspapers including titles from all 50 present states published between 1690 and 1922. Created by Readex through partnerships with the American Antiquarian Society, Library of Congress, Wisconsin Historical Society and others, this resource enables researchers to explore virtually every aspect of America during the 18th, 19th and early 20th centuries.Includes: Early American Newspapers, Series 1 (1690 - 1876), Early American Newspapers, Series 2 (1758 - 1900), Early American Newspapers, Series 3 (1829 - 1922), Early American Newspapers, Series 4 (1756 - 1922), Early American Newspapers, Series 5 (1777 - 1922), Early American Newspapers, Series 6 (1741 - 1922), Early American Newspapers, Series 7 (1773 - 1922).

children.name: U.S. Congressional Serial Set Maps, 1817-1994
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: Map images, records, and indexing for maps published in Reports and Documents of the 15th Congress, 1st Session through the 103rd Congress, 2nd session. Covering years of publication: 1817-1994, Serial Set Volumes: 1 - 14277.

children.name: U.S. Congressional Serial Set, 1817-1994
children.subject: Government & Politics|History|Political Science
children.desc: 15th Congress - 103rd Congress, 2nd session; The bound, sequentially numbered volumes of all the Reports, Documents, and Journals of the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives constitute a rich collection of primary source material on all aspects of American history.

children.name: Europa World
children.subject: Economics|Political Science|International Studies|Social Sciences
children.desc: Europa World is the online version of the Europa World Year Book, the indispensable source of information on world-wide affairs. First published in 1926, the year book is renowned as one of the world's leading reference works, covering political and economic information in over 250 countries and territories, from Afghanistan to Zimbabwe. Statistical data by country and directory contact details of nearly 2000 international organizations.

children.name: Routledge Encyclopedia of Modernism
children.subject: Film Studies|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Humanities|Literature|Theater and Dance
children.desc: Includes 1,000+ articles from experts in the field, supported by over 100 images. The content is fully cross-referenced and covers eight key subject areas: Literature, Architecture, Visual Arts, Music, Dance, Theatre, Film, and Intellectual Currents.

children.name: Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy
children.subject: Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Bioethics
children.desc: Provides access to over 2,700 articles. Regularly updated with new and revised articles for further discovery and research, clearly organised and with over 25,000 cross-references linking themes, concepts and philosophers. An ideal reference source for subjects related to philosophy, such as politics, psychology, economics, anthropology, religion and literature.

children.name: Monthly Statistics of International Trade
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc:
A reliable and up-to-date source of international statistics on international trade of OECD countries. It provides detailed insight into the most recent trends in trading patterns among OECD countries and with the
rest of the world. Data are broken down by economic groupings, by country and by region, and include seasonally adjusted series as well as calculated indicators. Includes ready-made tables, interactive databases, 'at a glance publications', and full reports.

children.name: OECD International Direct Investment Statistics
children.subject: Business|Economics|Social Sciences
children.desc: This database gathers detailed historical statistics on international direct investment to and from the OECD area. Data are broken down by geographical zone and industrial sector for direct investment flows and stocks.

children.name: Springer Link
children.subject: Mathematics|Statistics
children.desc: Providing researchers with access to millions of scientific documents from journals, books, series, protocols and reference works.

children.name: Handbook of Chemistry & Physics Online
children.subject: Chemistry|Physics
children.desc: Access the latest edition of the CRC Handbook of Chemistry & Physics. Includes Text, Structure/Property and Chemical search options. Sections in this edition includes; Mathematics, Properties and Physical Constants, Chemical Tables, Properties of Matter, Heat, Hygrometric and Barometric Tables, Sound, Quantities and Units, and Miscellaneous. The ultimate book of facts about chemistry and physics. This is a book that covers virtually every element, every physical formula, and every mathematical table imaginable and puts physical formulas and mathematical tables used in labs every day within easy reach.

children.name: Arts & Humanities Citation Index
children.subject: Classics|Digital Arts/Media|Film Studies|History|Music|Theater & Dance|Visual Arts|Modern Languages|Philosophy|Humanities|Ethics|Religious Studies|Jewish Studies
children.desc: Part of the Web of Science database, a multidisciplinary database covering the journal literature of the arts and humanities, with cited references but not abstracts. Indexes 1,300+ of the world's leading arts and humanities journals, plus individually selected, relevant items from over 7,000 major science and social science journals. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: BIOSIS Previews
children.subject: Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Neuroscience
children.desc: BIOSIS Previews contains the references to journal literature from Biological Abstracts, the references to meetings, reports, review articles, books and monographs from Biological Abstracts/RRM, as well as some unique references. Coverage extends from 1993 to the present.

children.name: Derwent Innovations Index
children.subject: Computer Science
children.desc: Facilitates rapid, precise patent searching, letting you conduct patent and citation searches of inventions in chemical, electrical, electronic, and mechanical engineering. Covering over 14.3 million basic inventions.

children.name: Incites (formerly Journal Citation Reports)
children.subject: Humanities|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences
children.desc: Resource includes citation data from 11,000+ scholarly and technical journals from more than 3,300 publishers in over 80 countries. Includes virtually all areas of science, technology, and social sciences. Shows the most frequently cited journals in a field; highest impact journals in a field; and largest journals in a field.

children.name: Inspec
children.subject: Computer Science|Engineering|Bioengineering|Physics|Mechanical Engineering
children.desc: Provides access to the world's scientific and technical literature in physics, electrical engineering, electronics, communications, control engineering, computers and computing, and information technology. Dates of coverage: 1969 through the present.

children.name: Science Citation Index
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Physics|Natural Sciences|Mechanical Engineering|Bioethics|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the sciences. With cited references from 1997 to the present. Includes new cited references to patents per week. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Social Sciences Citation Index
children.subject: Business|Slavic and East European Studies|Economics|Education|History|Sociology|Social Sciences|Ethics
children.desc: A interdisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the social sciences from 1997 to the present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Web of Science
children.subject: Engineering|Biochemistry|Bioengineering|Biology|Chemistry|Environmental Science|Physics|Social Sciences|Natural Sciences|Mathematics|Mechanical Engineering|Neuroscience|Astronomy|Nanotechnology Studies
children.desc: Includes ISI Science Citation Index 1997-present; Social Sciences Citation Index, 1997-present; and Arts & Humanities Citation Index, 1997-present. Search for specific articles by subject, author, journal, and/or author address. Search the databases for articles that cite a known author or work.

children.name: Value Line
children.subject: Business|Economics
children.desc: Provides investment research on stocks, mutual funds, options and convertibles, and offers a family of no-load mutual funds. Accurate investment research on companies, industries, markets and economies.

children.name: World Development Indicators
children.subject: Economics|International Studies
children.desc: World Development Indicators (WDI) publication is a collection of time-series data for 214 economies, with many indicators going back more than 50 years. WDI provides cross-country comparable statistics about development and people’s lives around the globe. It is divided into six sections -- World View, People, Environment, Economy, States and Markets, and Global Links.
